review.reviewBody: This has been a great jacket for me. I got the multi color jacket to match the pants and get loads of compliments. It's light weight but waterproof. I think it fits true to size and I typically wear a light puffy and baselayer under it since it's not insulated.
review.name: It's great

review.reviewBody: I ordered this in both a medium and a large. I'm generally a medium, 5-5 130lbs. I ended up sending them back as at this price I wanted to love the jacket. I found the medium tight with just a hoodie underneath. It measured 17" across the chest. The large fit more comfortably, however it was quite long on me. It came down mid thigh. It just didn't look great. The multi color is bright- great if you ski in low vis conditions. The orange though looked like I was wearing a cheap life preserver. The jacket did seem to have all the features one would want in a technical shell. The large measured about 18.25" across the chest. It was a straight fit, so if you have curves it may be a bit snug in the hips.
review.name: long slim fit - bright colors

review.reviewBody: Just received this jacket and I love it. I did size up from a medium to large for a slightly looser fit and ability for more layers. It looks great, keeps me warm, and has what you need. Maybe the only downside is no lower side pockets but when you have a backpack on you don?t go in there as much anyways. One of my favorite parts would be the thumb hole feature.
review.name: Love!

name: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a set of Black Diamond trekking poles a year ago because I was dealing with back problems that made walking difficult. I don’t want to use a cane because they make me look “old.” The poles fold into luggage and a tote bag so I can use them as needed while traveling. I need the tips for walking indoors. They work well. Back surgery is coming up, and I hope to be back on the trails by year’s end. I’ll still need the great poles. 

BTW, I live in Missoula, Montana, and many of use trekking poles rather than a cane because we refuse to give up.
review.name: Useful indoors

review.reviewBody: I work my z-poles pretty hard; Malta trails, Kumano Kodo Pilgrimage, West Highland Way and Kerry Camino (part of Dingle Way) in the past year. My tips needed replacing after all that work. This time around I realized that the rubber tip protectors would be a real benefit for the easy parts of trails to reduce wear on the rubber tips and provide a softer impact with little noise. The protectors slip off easily when the trail requires the more aggressive bite of the rubber tips.
review.name: Good addition to a great pole

review.reviewBody: I need to use 1-2 walking sticks now for an unstable knee - I had used my Black Diamond poles with metal tips for hiking for years, but now I need them daily for general walking & getting around and the Rubber Tip Protectors fit perfectly and I feel safer now as they protect on slippery surfaces. Highly recommend them.
review.name: Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors for walking sticks

review.reviewBody:
I own two (2) Black Diamond hiking/walking sticks with metal tips - fine for hiking but now I need the walking sticks to help me balance due to an unstable knee (surgery coming up).
I ordered the rubber tips and they are PERFECT & grip the road just fine. I ordered two pairs.
Customer Service was extremely helpful. Thank you Black Diamond, Wendie S-M
review.name: Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors for walking sticks

review.reviewBody: They fit my BD carbon fiber Z poles perfectly. Tough and durable. Just what I needed for a comfortable walk!
review.name: They fit my BD carbon

review.reviewBody:
I ordered a pair of rubber tips and two tiny Allen wrenches. They arriving a box with packing paper. An envelope would have sufficed. 
Goods as promised and on time
review.name: Sensible packaging??

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my 92 year old friend who uses my Z-Poles for stability in walking. He's thrilled to be able to walk without worrying about the tips slipping on hard surfaces inside and out! I know he'll wear them out and will be happy to re-order once that happens!
review.name: The Best!

review.reviewBody: These are too loose for my distance carbon FLZ poles; they are the correct tips. I think the reason for the varied responses is this: there is a shorter distance between the basket and the pole tip. In these REI video, that distance is longer and the pole tip is tapered, allowing the rubber tip to fit snugly on the pole tip. On my poles that fit is hindered by the basket. I am trying some silicone to keep the tip on but be able to replace when needed
review.name: Too loose

review.reviewBody: I love my Z Trekking pole but these pair of protectors are way too **loose** for fitting my poles and therefore useless.
review.name: Too loose for Z pole

review.reviewBody:
This is second time purchased this product, to protect tips and danger during travel.
Tips tend to come off and get lost.
Good idea, not so good reality.
review.name: See..

name: Z-Pole Rubber Tip Protectors

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought the gtx version back in summer for my daily wear in town shoe. Like them at first but about three months in the sole started peeling and the and the laces failed. 
Compared to my very first pair of heavy duty boot that I put many peak summits away with(mid to late 90s). These novas were not that! I'll be using other means of footwear from this experience forward. Euro is gear is at the Pinnacle for a reason . Please find quality  you had back in the day, again then maybe I'll be back. Thanks for listening 🤙
review.name: A for effort, that's about it

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I owned these for less than a month and had to return them because my feet got soaked. Not walking thru water, walking in wet grass.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Can be slippery. Fits like a slipper. So comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

comment: Thanks for the love Dave!

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Impressive Build and Quality! Comfortable like a tennis shoe but stable enough to be a hiker.
review.name: Light Hiker and comfortable for all day wear.

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: 10/10 would not recommend if you’re wanting waterproof. Comfortable yes. These shoes are not waterproof. My feet get wet with even the smallest amount of dew on the grass. We haven’t had rain here in over a month and my feet and socks are wet daily.
review.name: Not Waterproof
comment: We appreciate your feedback and would like to help in any way we can. Give our team a call at 800.288.3124. Thanks!

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable from the get go. Super light. Excellent grip on a variety of surfaces. Sunny and 75, didn't get to test the waterproofness.
review.name: First wear, fall hike

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these mainly because they were on sale. I have always wore the chameleon style.  Headed to Rocky Mt National Park, thought I'd give these a try.  They were great! No break in time needed. Trails were dusty from lack of rain but they gripped great with no slipping. Pretty much the only shoe I wore all week on and off the trail!
review.name: Trail grippers!

name: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good quality vest, very well constructed, i just wish the neck wasnt as heavily insulated
review.name: Good vest

review.reviewBody: Husband loves this. Fits great. Able to layer with other items
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality and really like the added water bottle holders on each side especially for those hot dove hunting days. Got it an awesome price too!
review.name: Nice vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very well made upland Vest that should hold up very well to hunting conditions. The item is a little on the heavy side and could use a few more shell loops in the pockets but that isn’t a deal breaker. If your looking for a quality made Upland Vest you will be very happy with this item.
review.name: Quality Upland Vest

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This vest has served me faithfully from New England grouse hunting to desert quail in Arizona and SharpTails in South Dakota. 

Its quality was proven last year when my GWP and I found ourselves in the biggest patch of sandburs I've ever seen -- she could only make it 30 feet before her feet were absolutely packed with them. I cleaned her paws out three times before throwing in the towel. With 3/4 mile to the truck and sand burs as far a the eye could see, I decided to sacrifice my Ptarmigan bird vest even if it only made it part-way. I unzipped the top zipper of the bird bag and re-zipped it around her, hoisting her onto my back for the trek to the truck. With 55 lbs of bird dog, 2 pheasants, most of a box of 20 gauge and a bottle of water, I really expected to have the vest fail in some way. The zipper was the obvious weak point, but no dice. Even though it was extremely overloaded, it came through unscathed and got my dog back to the truck where I would spend twenty minutes removing dozens of burrs from each of her paws. This vest proved its quality that day. 

Besides the build quality, the simplicity of the big front pockets allows me to grab a handful of shells and dump them in, while seeds and other chaff can fall out the soft mesh bottoms. 

Two front d-rings allow me to run my Garmin on a carabiner, while the dual side water bottle pockets are easy enough to differentiate from the back bird bag to be useful. 

The bird bag is ample, with a top zipper that allows for easy cleaning. That zipper doesn't come unzipped like some, and the quality is far greater than it needs to be, as evidenced by my dog-carrying experience.

Easily the best bird vest I've ever owned, and it's probably the fifth or sixth vest I've purchased. Especially when you factor in the reasonable price, I don't think you could find a better vest out there. I plan to buy another for myself and one for my dad.
review.name: Best bird vest for the money by far!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing product with lots of room and very comfortable good in warm and cold weather
review.name: Ptarmigan vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently purchased 3 of these vests. A friend of mine in Greece wanted one for himself and a friend. I sent him an XXL and a size L. The XXL was too big for my friend but he found another avid bird hunter like himself to give it to. I flew into Athens two days ago and had dinner with my friend Kosta and his fiancé Eleni. I gave him the size XL that I bought for him!!! He was sooo pleasantly surprised!!!! Columbia has die hard fans in Greece. Glad I could help!
review.name: Just made my Greek friend’s day!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can't go wrong with this vest. Feels and looks great. Bit pricey, but you get what you pay for.
review.name: Great fit, great quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Game pouch needs a bigger opening. The shell pocket is stretched at the corners with shells in the pocket. Not sure it will hold up long term
review.name: Vest

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Ptarmigan vest is great except for one flaw...it does not have front loading. Have your designers go Pheasant hunting and try to put the birds in the back pouch...good luck.

If it were redesigned with front loading for game entry I would purchase it even though I have purchased a new game vest.
review.name: Mens Bird Vest

name: Ptarmigan Bird Vest - Men's

description: Buy the Kelty Deluxe Lounge Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deluxe Lounge Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Deluxe Lounge Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These chairs are made so well, I have tried many over the years and this chair feels like it will last me many years to come, it’s taken some hard use so far and it’s held up and the fabric is still in great shape, this is a smart buy, this chair is well worth the investment.
review.name: Comfortable & robust chair

review.reviewBody: This is a great chair you will have for years to come. Going on 8 years with our other kelty sofa. These are built well with heavy canvas. All components are well thought out and beefed up in areas that get the most abuse. The cover/ carry bag is great and can be used for a mat. The adjustment on this model for the recliner is nice and works well. If you want a quality camp chair. Make sure to buy kelty
review.name: A great chair!

review.reviewBody: This chair was great for the 1st year. Last night I was sitting in it and one of the hinges that are plastic peeled apart and broke. Never seen anything like it. Contacted Kelty and they wont fix it and there response was “we don’t know of a company that can fix furniture” terrible customer service. Hoping Backcountry will correct this.
review.name: Garbage

review.reviewBody:
So there are two things that are great about this chair. The quality of the build and the cup holders. The steel frame is far superior to any other bag chair I have owned and the adjustable cup holders are fantastic for holding a drink and your phone. 

Now on to why I really dislike the chair. I am a taller woman at 5'9" and this chair height is WAY too high. I can't sit in the chair and have my feet touch the ground. I've honestly never met a chair that I had this issue with before. The front of the seat angles up and just digs into your thighs and it's not comfortable at all. I read this complaint on a review on another site but brushed it off unfortunately.

Another thing that I don't understand is why the highest position of this reclining chair is leaned so far back. If it has the option to recline, why not at least start in an upright position. 

Overall I would not  recommend this chair at all. I'm so sad I ripped the tag off and can't return it, so I'm stuck with a very expensive bag chair that I won't be using. I will say that I also got the Kelty low loveseat in this same style and liked that better, so if you are looking at these chairs, maybe go for the low profile ones if you are under 6 foot.
review.name: Chair seat is all wrong

review.reviewBody: I've never been one to opt for chairs, preferring my time around camp and in the backyard to be as close to the earth as possible... but, damn ! Having this in my camping collection has been very sweet. If I'm looking for something to be sink into and laze in, this does this job. It has traveled with me across the land, underneath Cascadian peaks, spent many beautiful calm evenings along the Clarion River, and kept me cozy while sipping on tasty Shacksbury ciders as the backyard fire flickers. Highly recommend !
review.name: a real beauty

name: Deluxe Lounge Chair

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: Extremely disappointed.  The battery lasts about 5 minutes.  It takes 10-15 attempts to get the pilot to work and then the unit randomly cuts out every couple of minutes. I have taken it on 5 camping trips and have still not had one successful use.  Initially I thought it was me not using it correctly but now I realize it just doesn’t work. It is poorly designed and cheaply built and the price tag was not low!  Not what I expect from Coleman which  I usually consider reliable
review.name: Terrible product
comment:
Hello,
We apologize for the inconvenience you’ve encountered. Our team is constantly striving to improve, and your comments will help us in that process.
Should you need further assistance or have more concerns, don’t hesitate to reach out to us at 1-800-835-3278, available Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5:30pm EST. You can also submit a formal complaint through our online platform: https://www.coleman.com/warranty-information.htmlor use our contact form: https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us.
Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention, and we apologize again for any inconvenience.
Best wishes,
Coleman Customer Care

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: The lid to the water container leaks.  The pump also leaks.  We had a very limited amount of water as we were off the grid, so the water loss made this item unusable.
review.name: Most of the connections leaked excessively.
comment:
We're sorry to hear about leaking in the product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to make positive changes.
Coleman Customer Care

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: I couldn't get it to stop leaking at the connection to the water tank. Any suggestions on troubleshooting? Did I need to install a gasket somewhere?
review.name: Leaking tank connection
comment:
Hello!

Thank you very much for your feedback on our Hot Water on Demand™ H2Oasis™ Portable Water Heater! We are very sorry to hear about the leaking issue and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused! It is is used according to the manual, then it should work properly. 

In that case, please kindly reach out to us directly via https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: Help I finally got time to use it and the battery doesn't recharge I know it's a problem anybody know where I can get one ?
review.name: Help
comment:
Hello, thank you for reaching out to us. 

Please kindly be informed that the replacement wall charger for this device is currently unavailable for individual purchases. However, we always make sure that customer feedback and concerns are shared as we are constantly looking for ways to improve our product and service.

Please reach out to us via our official Coleman "Contact Us" website or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9 am -5 pm Eastern Time.

Thank you and please stay safe!
Coleman Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: My BF bought me this as a gift. It was for both of us when we go camping and when I travel. The pump stopped working after a few uses. The product may not be good, but Coleman support was awesome!
review.name: Pump broke
comment:
Hello!

Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that your water heater stopped working, but we are glad that we are able to help you with your concern. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to make positive changes.


For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: Used 3 times pump quit. Cannot find a replacement!
review.name: Coleman sucks
comment:
Hello! 

Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that the pump in your water heater broke and you are unable to find a replacement. Please be advised that, currently, this unit's replacement pumps are not available for individual sale. But no worries, as we are always looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared 

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: Bought it when it first came out always works great!! Nothing like having a hot shower camping!!
review.name: Worth its weight in gold!!

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: I bought the Coleman portable water heater, charged it up and took it on my trip to a very remote lake in Ontario, Canada.  It would not stay on for more than about 5 seconds.  I tried recharging it and it would do the same.  I had one of these units years ago and it worked great but this one was a dud and very disappointing as I used a 62 degree lake to shower every night and I packed it all the way in with fuel.
review.name: Very disappointed!

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: Brand new out of the box the battery would not hold a charge for more than 2 minutes.
review.name: Won’t hold charge
comment:
Hello! We’re sorry to hear that the battery of your water heater is not working. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. Your feedback is highly appreciated and valued by the business, and we will make sure that your insights are shared. 

 If you have any additional queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.itemreviewed: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater
review.reviewBody: This water heater is great when is working properly.  Unfortunately I have not found a place where it can be serviced nor there are any instructions to properly maintain it.   It seems to me there should be more support for a product that is not inexpensive as this one.   This is the second one I purchased and I am not happy by having to dispose of it again because I can't find anyone to repair it.   After using them for about a year, the heater would not stay lit or it turns itself off.  Apparently the water does not flow through the unit correctly and i suspect it is because it needs to be serviced.
review.name: Too expensive to be disposable
comment:
Hello!

Thank you for your feedback. While we are happy that the water heater functions as intended, we find it disappointing that no maintenance advice or services are offered. Please be aware that we are working to address this concern. Rest assured that your feedback is being used to improve our products and services.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

name: Hot Water On Demand H2Oasis Portable Water Heater

review.reviewBody: Hestar makes great gloves. These are super convenient, still quite warm and dry fast. My only complaint is they don’t have a way to fasten together, but do have loops —can attach together with micro-carabiner
review.name: Like them so much, bought a seincd pair

review.reviewBody: Bought these in January 2022 and by January 2023 they already had holes in the thumbs and are generally starting to fall apart. They also aren't nearly as warm as I'd thought they'd be.
review.name: Didn't last a year

review.reviewBody: This is my first HESTRA product and it didn't disappoint. The brand is known for quality and the price is steep. Spend the money and buy it once. These gloves are very comfortable and warm. Easy to put on, and easier to take off. The gloves have a small length strap stitched between index and middle fingers, and pinky and ring fingers. They function as tabs to pull the glove off your hand. Simple but useful. Your thumb can also be exposed. I normally wear a size L for most gloves, I purchased this in a size 10 and it was too big. Returned and bought a size 9. Absolutely recommend.
review.name: surprisingly warm

review.reviewBody: I’ve got a near new Trex Verve 3 city bike and there was zero possibility of getting this to fit. The specs say it accepts tires up to 720mm. Not true. The tire hits the static tire rest and won’t mount. For the love of me I can’t figure out what the design purpose of this is anyway, but it’s about 1/2” too small to fit my bike. Garmin’s customer service gave zero help, only stating that they “recommend an indoor training tire.”  Nowhere in their marketing is this stated. Nowhere in their own web page. The only choice I had was to trade out to a different tire which is obviously not as convenient as “mounting your bike easily.”  Total fail
review.name: Misleading

name: Tacx Boost Trainer Bundle

description: Buy the RovR RollR 45 Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: RollR 45 Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the RovR RollR 45 Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The telescoping handle is very weak and cannot handle the weight of the cooler with product inside. (It broke!) The handle available with the larger cooler is sturdy and a much better design. Very disappointed in my purchase. Furthermore, it says a lot that these were put on the market for sale. they sell a replacement handle under accessories. It's "sold out"
review.name: Inferior handle design

review.reviewBody: I have the Rovr 45 but the inside plug became attached and I can’t get it back in and l don’t want to force it and damage anything.  How do I fix this?   HELP…Love the cooler
review.name: Ice plug came out

review.reviewBody: I will rate it a 5 star for now. When the beach wheels are back in stock we will put it to the real test.
review.name: Looks great, need my beach wheels.

review.reviewBody:
Planning for a week-long trip without access to anywhere close, I researched the best ice chests and found the RovR with the best reviews versus Yeti, RTIC and others.  I wanted to love the RovR and “test drove” it in an easy evaluation.

I followed the instructions exactly.  I brought the “45” into the house the day before; partially filled it the night before to cool it down; filled the chest with things straight from the refrigerator or freezer and then filled the remaining space with ice.  We traveled for 4 hours and stopped at a place with a refrigerator.  We removed all food and placed in the fridge or freezer.  The next morning, we replaced the food and topped the 45 off with ice.  We continued to our destination – also with a refrigerator and removed all the food.  The ice chest remained in an air-conditioned house for 5 days, with the lid closed and never opened.

When we packed to return home, I opened the chest and had cool water and no ice.  The hope for 7 to 10 days with no access to ice leaves me disappointed and am returning it.

What I liked about the RovR 45:  I like the “deep freeze” to be able to store foods I don’t want to get wet.  I like that the first day and a half there was very little melted water that drained out. I like the design of the slope inside that allows fast, easy draining.

What I did not like:  1.  Obviously the 4 days of keeping ice from melting without opening the lid.  2. The handle design does not handle the weight of the chest, even when empty.  In the first, lower position for pulling the 45 up a small step, the weight of an empty chest will jerk the handle loose to the fully extended position.  Even then the handle is not “stiff” and makes handling the chest difficult.  I have better handles on a rolling suitcase.  3.  The capacity of the 45-quart cooler does not provide as much space for food as I would expect.  In fact, the REI description of the capacity is: “The 45 Cooler capacity is as follows: With the Deepfreeze dry bin installed: 24 cans and 10 pounds of ice in the main compartment and 4-6 bottles upright with other food stuffs in the dry compartments. Without the Deepfreeze dry bin installed: 60 cans and 10 pounds of ice.”

I was packing, and would pack more than cans and bottles, and I did use 10 pounds of ice but took fish, meat, vegetables, and fruit.  I am thinking / wondering if the 45 is designed for a day at the beach rather than outdoor camping.  

I hope you find my comments helpful and am disappointed that it is not the solution I need.
review.name: Better for the beach than the woods?
comment: Thanks for the detailed review and feedback Rotivoli. Upgrades are on the way!

review.reviewBody: This cooler is amazing! We bought the 80 and drove for 3 days in July. We never needed to replace the ice. We got this 45 for another road trip.
review.name: Amazing cooler

review.reviewBody: It is hard to review something when I have not even got it yet. I ordered weeks ago. I sent an email and still waiting on a reply. So far I will not be recommending this brand to anyone and wold tell them to go else where.
review.name: WHERE IS MY STUFF????
comment: Sorry about the wait James! We apologize and will do all we can to make sure this doesn't happen again.

review.reviewBody: I received this cooler for Christmas from my husband and it has been the absolute best! I am a travel hockey mom - rolling this in and out of hotels - with the attached tote - is perfect. I took away 1 star because the telescoping handle does not extend past the first click - I have gotten it to extend fully without significant effort.
review.name: Absolutely LOVE this cooler!

review.reviewBody: Loving it.  Took it to our first lakeside picnic. I was surprised that it held my five year old.  She climbed on top of it while I pulled it back to the car.  Built tough!
review.name: Tough!

review.reviewBody: The ROVR 45 is beautiful went with the Midnight color and a plain white lander bin the combo is sweet! Haven’t used it yet but am super excited to do so
review.name: Looks good!

review.reviewBody: This cooler has been amazing! Got to use it recently on a camping trip and beach vacation. Rolls over everything and the storage bag holds a ton. Ice holds for a long time. We got 2 days before we needed to top up. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Worth it

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Spark Pro Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spark Pro Sleeping Bag: 15F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Spark Pro Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is always with me, if I am not using to stay extra toasty in my bag, I use it as a pad sheet for sleeping on during the hot desert nights. Absolute must have for any serious outdoors person
review.name: Perfect kit addition

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best purchase ever! I bought this for the COLD fall nights backpacking in Glacier Park, and it did not disappoint. Keeps me toasty warm. I love the light weight, and it packs down fairly small. The baffles and extra down in the hood are great touches. Would 100 percent recommend this sleeping bag.
review.name: Sea to summit Spark Down zero degree sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't taken this bag out yet but I've tested it at home and it's feather-light and so comfortable. We're going backpacking this weekend and I'll report back.
review.name: so soft and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag has just about every feature you could wish for. You can unzip the arm area, the foot area, and fully unzip it to use as a blanket. You can even zip two bags together! It cinches up around the head and neck area to keep in maximum warmth. It’s also filled with goose down, allowing it to be both breathable and incredibly warm. What I’m still blown away by is the weight- it comes it at under 2 lbs and compresses down into a very small pack. This is perfect for overnight hikes where every ounce matters. I’m so excited to bring this along for cold weather camping!
review.name: High Quality, Lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this sleeping bag!!! It is probably the most comfortable, well insulated sleeping bag I've ever owned! I've attached pictures of it unrolled with no one in it, and a pic of me inside with room to spare! The hood attachment part is probably the best part in my opinion. No more cold heads when camping! Rolling it back up for storage was also super easy, which is always a plus. I would definitely recommend this to anyone camping, especially in colder climates!
review.name: Best sleeping bag ever!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Spark Pro Down Sleeping Bag 15F is a dream of a bag for ultralight backpacking. It packs down incredibly small, making it a great choice for long treks where every ounce counts. This high-performance bag is also comfortable and toasty, with a roomy ergonomic mummy shape that offers a good balance of warmth and wiggle room. This is an excellent choice for serious backpackers.
review.name: Ultralight and toasty comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Planning to go camping this October and I am so excited to use this sleeping bag. I’ve tested it out outside and it is so snug and comfy, I am happy to be able to put it to use soon. Literally can’t wait to camp using this sleeping bag
review.name: Lightweight and awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really nice sleeping bag!  Not to warm not too cold this sleeping bag is just right.  Very soft and compresses nicely to fit in the included carrying case.
review.name: Really nice sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and soft material. I love that their are zippers on the side to vent but also you can take your arms out. Folds up small and has a carrying case so it doesn't take up a lot of space.
review.name: Very warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is the nicest one I’ve ever seen and will use! It is extremely lightweight but still able to keep you toasty warm. It unzips two different ways so you can roll down the front flap or just unzip one side. It has snaps and bungee cords you can use to help lock in warmth and make sure you are keeping out the cold. The stuffing feels thin but that also helps it to compact and easily put back in the compression bag and storage carrier. This won’t add hardly any weight if you are backpacking into your camp. The size is great for one person but there is an option to zip two bags together to share. And I love that there are accessories available to buy separately for it like a pillow and an inflatable pad. Which if you are sleeping on rocky ground, you’ll probably want as this doesn’t have much “padding”. This sleeping bag is warm but breathable and for anyone who camps, this is expensive but definitely worth the quality to have.
review.name: Wow!

name: Spark Pro Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

description: Buy the Jetboil Genesis 2 Burner Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Genesis 2 Burner Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil Genesis 2 Burner Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Owned for A year and 5 months. The dial to close or open flame broke off. It's connected to a tooth pick size metal pole. One burner is fully open now which makes the entire unit useless.
review.name: Engineers pov
comment: Thank you for your review and observations regarding the spindle. This is a warranty issue and we invite you to call Customer Service at 800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST. When calling, please have the stove, regulator arm and your original receipt on-hand. We look forward to your call so that we may be of additional help.

review.reviewBody: Cooks with precise heat level. High quality construction that will last.

Spent a lot of money on this product as everyone else has and I’d expect the best. Straight out of the box on one side is sparking, obviously I can bring a light with me but incredibly frustrating considering.
review.name: Brand new, no spark.
comment: Thank you for posting your review. You may contact the international Distributor for Jetboil in Australia for guidance on warranty or possible troubleshoot to address issue with the igniter feature. The company is Sea to Summit and you can reach them via their website at www.seatosummit.com.au  or by emailing them at enquiries@seatosummit.com.au .

review.reviewBody: Having the Genesis has really improved our camp meals. The versatility of having a skillet and pot that stores in a small footprint is great. The pot and pan both clean up very easily.
review.name: Exceptional camp stove

review.reviewBody: Efficient and compact, this is the little stove that could. The only thing I would change is the price, even then, its still worth it and the return will outweigh any concerns I have about the upfront cost. This little fuel sipper is amazing with almost an infinite adjustability.
review.name: Get it!

review.reviewBody: Excellent flame and even heat output. Only flaw is the windshield is pretty much worthless because it is so flimsy
review.name: Best on the Market

review.reviewBody:
I've had about a half dozen stoves over the last two years - all of which perform terribly.  However, none of the others, cost as much as the Basecamp, and none of them were as virtually useless in the wind. 
A lot of reviewers complain about the windscreen and the regulator.  The regulator hasn’t crapped out on me yet… the windscreen is in the rubbish bin… I am going to fabricate my own windscreen and see if I can salvage this stove.  As it is – we are talking about 20-30 minutes to make coffee in a percolator – meaning to boil water – and as for bacon and eggs… the eggs cook but only after warming my cast iron after a half hour or more to somewhat cook bacon. 
Again, I’ve tried a lot of stoves. Due to the 19mph gusts I get here in Texas this stove is useless. I’ve used it in Colorado, Montana, New Mexico, Wyoming, South Dakota, and a few other places.  I continue to use it because of what I paid for it – hoping to find a solution to salvage it. 
I am committed to fabricating my own wind screen to see if that makes this expensive hunk of junk usable.  I would not recommend, and I would not buy this stove.   My style of camping is overland 4x4 adventures and car camping.
review.name: Virtually Useless
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We are sorry that you are having trouble with your Genesis and would like the opportunity to speak with you further on this. If you could please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday, we would be happy to hear from you.

review.reviewBody: Great 2-burner camping stove.  Easy to setup; very small footprint; excellent cooking efficiency; and easy to clean.
review.name: Feedback after use on several campouts.

review.reviewBody: Super fine flame adjustment.  Light for car camping
review.name: Awesome stove

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend this for every camper! It fits in a 5 gallon bucket on top of my pots and pans perfectly!
review.name: Best stove on the market!

name: Genesis 2 Burner Stove

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The dress is very comfortable and I love the pockets! I wear mine as a beach coverup!
review.name: Nellie Dress

review.reviewBody: I love this dress - very cute, comfortable and cool for summer days. However, size up! It shrinks, even when washed as directed 😢
review.name: Size up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and flattering dress! I normally wear a medium but after reading reviews, decided to go with small and it fits perfect. The navy is so cute with a flower print and quality is great. Love the looseness and flow, pockets are a bonus.
review.name: Love this dress!!

review.reviewBody: The fabric of the Peach chambray is really nice. Like a soft linen. The fit is a little off if you're a smaller person. Agree with other reviews that the top half is not proportioned with the bottom half of the dress. I originally went with the size chart's recommendation of a small for me. ( I am a size 4, usually translates to a small) The dress was really big. Big armholes, way too much fabric on the bottom, it just looked silly. Exchanged for an XS. Much better top half but the bottom could have been proportioned better for a small person, Still too much fabric and the bottom tier is on the big side, but i think as hot as PNW Summers are getting, its going to feel as good as it gets without being out and out naked, haha. For reference; 5'4" 117lbs, 34B. The dress hit just at the knee in front, a little longer in back. Pro tip- if you are any bigger than a 34B, XS probably won't work.
review.name: Big but cute

review.reviewBody: Love this light and airy dress. Perfect for hot summers. Very soft fabric.
review.name: Cool and comfortable

review.reviewBody: It was a cute dress, but I did end up returning because it was a little big on top for me.
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this same dress last year in one of the linen fabrics in a medium and it fits perfectly (5’3, muscular and curvy). I was so excited when I saw the faded blue with the flowers because it would be perfect for spring.

The color certainly did not disappoint and is consistent with what is shown on the website however something was completely off with the fit of bust of the dress. Waist down is perfect, but the chest is incredibly tight and just about smashed me in and is completely different than the fit of last years version. I almost think the measurements were off for the top portion when manufactured. 

I was tempted to exchange for a large, but didn’t need extra room in the waist or added length so I opted to return. I am so bummed because it is such a cute pattern, but it was just not meant to be! 

Hopefully the one I received was a one off, but I wanted to leave a review in case others might want to order two sizes :)
review.name: Cute Pattern - Sizing Off

review.reviewBody: This dress is so flattering and the material will be perfect for summer. I can also wear it to work! I might need more colors!
review.name: Perfect Summer Dress

review.reviewBody: Cute dress, Perfect for summer. The dark fawn is a pretty color and the linen materials is lightweight and comfortable. I'll pair it with a jean jacket in the fall. Love it!
review.name: Cute dress, Perfect for summer.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this dress! Beautiful linen! Great fit!
review.name: Love this!

name: Nellie Linen Dress - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research SuperStrand LT Vest - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very light, very warm. It can be layered or it can stand alone.  It is true to size.  I am 67 years old, 5ft 2in, 115 lbs and I got the medium so that I would have room for a fleece or heavy sweater underneath.
review.name: Love this vest

review.reviewBody: This vest is lightweigh and very comfortable. A great length and overall fit. It doesn't poke my face around the neck (like many other vests or jackets). I purchased the sulphur for it's safety visibility. I am 5'8" & 140 lbs and the size Small is perfect. I gave it a 4-stars instead of 5-stars because I can see the down/fill material through the outer nylon fabric.
review.name: Comfortable, Light, and Warm

review.reviewBody: I've looked at women's vests, but haven't purchased one until now. Many of the other vests are puffy and I felt like I'd look like a marshmallow in one. The SuperStrand LT Vest is warm, fits comfortably and is attractive. The vest is just the right amount of warmth without all the puffiness.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Super warm for how thin and lightweight it is. It immediately became a staple for both alpine and XC skiing in NW Montana. At 5'9" & 155 lbs, the large leaves plenty of room for layering underneath. One request- I wish they made one with a hood for the extra chilly days!
review.name: Warm and lightweight

review.reviewBody: Great for XC skiing, cold weather hiking, or cool walking around town. Very light weight and easily packable. I run hot when running, so this is too warm for me. I have wide hip and a small waist and the medium fits great. its not tight on the hips. Loving the giant zipper pockets.
review.name: Lightweight vest for high output activities

review.reviewBody: I bought this to go under an on-area ski insulated coat for a bit more warmth. While the large did zip up, it was just big enough around the hips wearing my jeans and one light shirt. With ski pants, long underwear, etc. it would have been too small. Big enough (extra) around the top but that is not unheard of for me.
review.name: A bit small for me

review.reviewBody: Perfect for winter layering. Thin and lightweight.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: I love this vest (and the jacket/hoody version, too), but I have to take one star away for the lack of a chest pocket. To me, that's a major flaw; I need that chest pocket for easy access to my phone, chapstick, map, etc). If I'm wearing a climbing harness (often), the side pockets are useless. Please add a chest pocket! I'd also love a hood on this vest. Otherwise, great colors and fits well.
review.name: Really nice...could be better

review.reviewBody: I love this vest! It's lightweight, but gives warmth. Perfect for hiking!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: It would be cool if there was a way to fold down the collar and snap, but really I love this vest either way! I lost mine weeks after buying and knew I had to replace it as soon as I got home, and replace in Larch! So light, careful the wind doesn't carry it away! I haven't wanted a vest for ages but gave this a try as I run hot, and it has converted me! If you are between XL and XXL, get the larger, it will be better for layering and flexibility, I did and I think it is why I love it so much. I don't feel stuffed in it, but it makes great fluff for adding to stuff sack pillows. You'll need more though, as it packs down quite small.
review.name: Lost mine and replaced it quick as I could!

name: SuperStrand LT Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great durable waders, the padding on the knees are great for low profile casting near spooky fish. Only downside I can find is I wish it had more belt loops going forward so I didn’t have to re-set it every time and so I can carry a holster.
review.name: Durable fish pantaloons

review.reviewBody: I’ve used these three times and like them a lot. They replaced an old pair of waist high hunting waders that had started to leak. They’re comfortable to get around in, though a bit long. The cuffs and reinforced knees are great features. Pockets are handy but not bulky. Belt needs loops. Quality seems excellent. I only use them in winter so I hope they last a long time.
review.name: A big step up

review.reviewBody:
Just what you'd expect from SIMMS.  Great design.  Excellent fit.  Durable materials.  Quality workmanship.  Love the built-in knee cushioning.
I'd like to see a larger water proof pouch on the SIMMS models.
review.name: Simms Fishing Waders

review.reviewBody: Awesome wader but I personally wish they had belt loops and a removable inner pouch like all the other models.

I just received your waders and I have to say these are my favorite waders that I own. The fit is excellent and the padded shoulder pads are very comfortable. I do a lot of fishing on my knees when the water is low and clear to keep a low profile and the knee pads work great. I love these waders and would recommend them to anyone looking for a great pair of waders
review.name: Great waders built well with built in knee pads doesn’t get much better

review.reviewBody:
This is the first pair of waders I've had to buy in 15 years an OH BOY what an upgrade. They've seen a handful of trips since purchase. When it was 65F outside they did not feel hot; when it was 28F outside this last weekend with a base layer under they felt just warm enough standing in the middle of a river. 

I really like the external knee pads--scrambling up and down slightly sketchy canyons to try and catch a trout, sharp rocks were just one less thing to worry about. The chest pockets are also well placed for easy access. I like that the guards that go over your boots don't have a hook on them but instead fit tight enough onto the boot themselves to hold strong without me noticing. 

Zero hesitations in recommending these for anyone looking to stand in a river and slay trout.
review.name: Buy These Waders

review.reviewBody: Where have these been all my life?  I’m 70 yoa and have just discovered the importance of good (and reasonably priced) waders. I’m trying but have yet to find ANYTHING I don’t love about these waders. Don’t have the energy or time to list all the great things about this wader. If you’re thinking of  investing in good reasonably priced waders, check these out. You won’t be disappointed. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Love them!!!!

review.reviewBody: Been looking for waders with extra knee padding. I love SIMMs waders, but always looking for a little more knee pad. I found em’ with the confluence. I’m always on my knees, whether it’s flipping rocks for entomology, or posing for a picture. My waders take a beating at the knees. Not to mention how painful it is to kneel on the ground with rocks and pebbles digging into your knees. I Absolutely love these. They got great. I’m 6’1”, weigh 185lbs, size 11 shoes. I got a size large. They fit great. Very comfortable. Great pockets as well. Huge fan.
review.name: Knee padding did the trick!

name: Confluence Stockingfoot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch High Water 50L Duffel Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just purchased this and used it over the weekend. Ended up in a rainstorm in the bed of my truck and held up great and kept everything dry. I plan on getting more use out of it next week on a hunt.
review.name: Workhorse of a bag

review.reviewBody: I'm a huge mystery ranch fan and generally love their products. However, this bag was very disappointing. I took it on a lazy tubing trip, the bag floated along beside me in the water. I was very surprised to find a fair bit of water in it after a 3 hour trip. This was a very slow, nearly standstill type of trip, so I was very surprised it was not water tight. Unclear to me how the water got in since we did not unzip the bag. I think the water just soaked in through the material.
review.name: Very disappointed with this bag!

review.reviewBody: I used this for the first time last weekend for a boondocking camp trip in the Pryor Mountains.  I don't have to worry about this bag getting thrown in the back of a dusty truck or being left out in the rain.  It's completely water proof with a zipper like a zip lock bag essentially.  The shoulder carry straps are comfy.  there are two mess pockets on the outside of the water proof bag for things you don't need to stay clean/dry.  Would definitely recommend this duffel for anyone that likes to travel to dirty places.  Would also be great for boating.
review.name: Perfect Montana Travel Companion

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased two High water duffel bags and I couldn't be happier with my decision. The bag exceeded my expectations by keeping all my belongings dry even in heavy rain. The material is durable, and the design is sleek, making it perfect for both outdoor activities and travel. The spacious interior and compact folding when empty is also a major plus. Overall, this waterproof duffel bag is a great investment for anyone needing a reliable and high-quality bag for any weather condition. Highly recommend it.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag a month ago and used it on a 3 day portage in Algonquin Park. We had wet weather for the first two days and it kept my gear dry. If you are packing something lofty like a sleeping bag ensure you use the tie down straps inside or the zipper can open with enough direct pressure (leaning on it in behind me while steering). Great bag!
review.name: Great water proofing

review.reviewBody: This is a good waterproof bag made from outstanding materials. I removed one star because there should be zip tabs at each end of the zipper to help opening and closing the bag.  Once the zipper is moving it is very smooth.  The zipper hold-tabs would be helpful and give you a place to grab the bag. The shoulder pads seem to be a notch below the quality of the rest of the duffle bag.  Otherwise I’m very happy with it.
review.name: Good but not great

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the High Water Duffel from Mystery Ranch. I had been looking for a mid-size waterproof duffel to carry expensive gear in the bed of my pick-up. The truck's hard bed cover is lockable but not waterproof. I had tried other brands but was never satisfied so I returned them. I've owned a Mystery Ranch Three-Day Assault bag for years and use it every day so when I saw that the company had introduced a 50 liter waterproof 
duffel I ordered one.

The bag more than meets my requirements. The giant central compartment swallows as much gear as I shove into the dry-zipper opening. The dry-zipper functions smoothly every time with no snags. Per MR,s recommendation I applied zipper wax. I utilized the dry zipper wax crayon that I use for my SCUBA dry-suit zipper. The High Water Duffel's main compartment is 100% waterproof, and has been severely tested in the short time that I've owned it. The bag rode in the bed of my truck during a week long, wind-driven rain-filled Northern California road trip. The following week I used it during two days of outdoor range training occurring in continuous heavy rain and wind in Los Angeles. On both occasions the exterior of the bag was completely wet while the interior compartment and contents remained bone dry. But the waterproof exterior fabric quickly wiped dry with a towel.

I like that the bag has minimal organization, which allows it to accommodate multiple large, bulky items.  As my rapid deployment bag, it is currently holding both soft body armor and a hard rifle plate carrier, gun belt, holster, pistol and rifle magazines, IFAK, helmet, and light breaching tools, There is still room remaining for a jacket, combat pants and boots. The bag has two exterior mesh zippered pockets--the bag's only organization--which is perfect for smaller items such as chem-lights, markers, flashlight, goggles, waterproof notebook, and a thirty-foot nylon strap. There are four external daisy-chain attachment points running perpendicular to the long axis. I have a carabiner attached which holds door wedges.

The bag can be carried as either a backpack or a traditional duffel bag. It comes with two quick detachable padded shoulder straps that can be reconfigured as a single duffle strap. There are also two reinforced carry handles on either end.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase. I'm actually considering buying a second High Water Duffel to carry clothing and other items on long road trips and/or to carry dry items on the deck of an operational dive boat. Mystery Ranch hit it out of the park with this one.
review.name: HW DUFFEL--Where Have You Been All My Life...

review.reviewBody:
I've owned this for about two months and am overall happy with it.  There is a lot of utility with a waterproof duffel and the dimensions of this one (longer, broader, and flatter than most) that make it ideal for Mystery Ranch's Overload system was the main selling point.  Durable: I'm confident the material will take a beating.  I drop it wherever is convenient.
Comfortable: The handles on each end are great for shuttling the pack short distances.  The backpack straps are more comfortable than I would have guessed.  I thought I would miss the handle in the middle of the duffel or a wrap to link the backpack straps, but I haven't.
Simple: There aren't many bells are whistles.  The only thing inside are two compression straps, no pockets.  I kind of wish there were a couple pockets on either end/side.  You have the mesh ones on the outside, but obviously there not waterproof.  There isn't a flap, so when you open the bag it remains mostly closed.  Once you get the zipper going, it's smooth, but I do wish there were pull tabs on either end of the zipper to hold on while you pull the zipper open and closed.  It's not necessary, because it's a straight pull for the "Tru" zipper, but the tabs would make a better experience.     

Or
review.name: A  sturdy waterproof duffle suited for Overload

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag for a general purpose dump bag for my raft for fishing/hunting season in SW Montana.  Its first use was on a late season float hunt where it spit rain and snow on us.  We also piled 2 deer into the boat on top of it by the end of the day.  My gear was clean and dry inside despite the conditions outside. Highly recommend.
review.name: Impeccable design.  Keeps gear dry.

name: High Water 50L Duffel Bag

hasVariant.name: X01 Eagle 12-Speed Chain
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM X01 Eagle 12-Speed Chain online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The X01 chain is the best option of the 12 speed chains. It is worth the extra money over the GX, and lower.
review.name: Lighter and lasts longer than GX

review.reviewBody: Best bang for your buck with SRAM Eagle drivetrains. X01 has significantly better longevity than NX or GX chains and is slightly cheaper than XX1. Highly recommend this chain. Been through a few of them over the years
review.name: X01 = The right choice

review.reviewBody: Shifts great with the drivetrain matched to it. I change my chains every season and keep my drivetrain clean....depending on ride frequency, sometimes twice/3 times a week.
review.name: Works fine

name: X01 Eagle 12-Speed Chain

description: Buy the Eureka! Northern Breeze 12 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Northern Breeze 12
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Northern Breeze 12 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my second NB screen tent. Its10 years old and it's still holding up very well with an average of 1.5 month of use per season. When I heard this tent would be discontinued I immediately bought another one with the fear of never being able to replace my old one when the time come. Best tent ever
review.name: Best creen tent ever made

review.reviewBody:
We took this camping for a week. Set up is super easy. I was surprised with how low the entry point is. I’m 5’11” and I had to duck down a little. This wasn’t the case when I put up the poles to have the front canopy, but high winds hit and I had to take those down. 

Speaking of high winds, for some reason these screens deflect most of the wind. It’s pretty impressive. (Definitely tie-down your corners with rope and stake down the corners.) I just wish the middle of each side had a tie-down point to alleviate some of the dipping down the ceiling did with the wind. 

Lastly, a huge storm hit. I dropped the walls and staked everything down. The corners aren’t exactly 100% water tight, but the walls did their job. 

I would definitely recommend this tent to anyone under 6 feet tall.
review.name: Nice screen house/shelter, but could be better.

review.reviewBody: Wife and I love the tent, hate the floor system.  This tent would be a homerun if it only had a nice floor in it.
review.name: Love the Tent

review.reviewBody: This is our third Northern Breeze - new modifications  are awesome. Our other two are still going strong- passed on to our adult kids who all camp in Eureka- the oldest one dates back to them in high school- 20+ years
review.name: Northern Nreeze rocks!

review.reviewBody: While building a cabin in a remote northern location I basically lived in this screen tent for three weeks. Went through a few extreme thunderstorms and everything stayed dry with the storm flaps down. Brough my tools in the screen house when it rained and there was plenty of room for tools and living. Good quality overall. It held up well to daily use.
review.name: Three weeks with the northern breeze

review.reviewBody:
Ok. I don't normally review stuff, but I got to with this one. I went out for a week of primitive camping at Dale Hollow Lake and was hit by severe storms and tornadoes that touched ground three miles from us.
When the initial front blast hit us, it took out all our tents and equipment with tornado force winds. All but this Screen Shelter from Eureka. I am very impressed by it as it held up to those winds with very high speeds. it blew it hard too, but the poles and guy lines held tight. Everything inside was kept dry by the side walls which we put down when the storms came through. Only thing that snapped was one of the bungie loops holding up a corner but easy to fix. Very good job on this Eureka!
review.name: Held up to winds from heavy storms

review.reviewBody: This is really big!   It was easy to put up and stands up to wind and rain!  I love it!!
review.name: Great value and really spacious!!!

review.reviewBody:
We really loved the  design of the Northern Breeze 12 Screen Room.  The 12 x 12 model has plenty of room 
and some nice features.  It has doors on both sides so you can open both for a nice breeze, and shade which 
is great for a hot day.  The sides can all be completely covered for cool nights, or opened with screen for protection 
from bugs (even noseeums).

Setup is easy for 2 but I can set it up by myself.  You can even put the doors up as a canopy.  We really love this 
screen room, it looks good and is real versatile.

One big issue, otherwise 5 stars for sure.  It just hasn't held up, after about 1 1/2 years we have lots of issues with 
durability.  We use the screen room in Florida in the Winter where it does get breezy and lots of sunshine.  From 
the wind, the elastic connections at the top corners broke ( 3 of 4).  Three of the clip straps came off, I had to sew 
new ones on.  The side material (not the roof) started dry rotting already.  We have lost a complete side, and 1 
door panel.  The rest has many tares I have taped to try get a little more use before we discard it.
review.name: Nice design....But
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear about the durability issue with your Northern Breeze 12. This is designed for temporary (not seasonal) installation and prolonged direct sunlight is likely to be a large contributing factor. We invite you to contact Customer Service 1-800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST  for assistance.

review.reviewBody: Kept the bugs out and kept all the family (extended) dry, bug free (mosquitos and gnats), and made a great prep space for meals... as well as a great sitting spot when the bugs or drizzling rain came through.
review.name: Great for family gatherings / outdoor lunch in NoMi.

review.reviewBody: This is an absolutely bomb proof shelter.  The ONLY weak point with this is the canopy and the poles.  It would be awesome if the poles for the canopy were adjustable so that when it rains the can just be adjusted downward.  We left camp to go for a hike and got a random rain storm we weren't expecting and left the canopy up.  We came back to the center pole snapped in half at one of the joints.  We didn't get very much rain, but the canopy holds water because it's waterproof (a good thing!). We splined it with some sticks and Gorilla Tape for the rest of our camping trip and that worked ok.  We just had to drop the canopy down every single time we walked away from camp in case it rained, which is kind of annoying.  The canopy held up to 50mph winds one night too without issue.  We get a handful of drips along the backside of the tent during heavy rain, but overall I am very pleased with the tent minus the snapped pole the 2nd day.
review.name: The best shelter tent

name: Northern Breeze 12

description: Buy the Gregory Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is the second one of these we’ve gotten for all business and vacation trips. Holds a week of clothes easily. Keeps things organized. Fits in overhead on a plane. Carries comfortably when full. Zippers are bombproof. Great product. 

Not for the outdoors per se, but we just used it last week across three countries in Europe and multiple flights and train trips without a hitch. New features with water bottle pocket and laundry sleeve are nice too.
review.name: Who’d ever want to use a roller bag again?

review.reviewBody: Good design, the primary reason for my purchase. However, I am about to embark on a 12 day trip, and will find out soon how good it works in the field. Construction is good, I like the waist strap that is adjustable and can be tucked away.
review.name: Good design awaiting field test

review.reviewBody:
Well Made. The compartments make sense. It is possible to slightly over-pack it so that it won't fit in the smallest of overhead compartments but I was able to remove a jacket and it went in. 

I do wish that more color options were available.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: Perfect airline travel bag. Fits in most if not all overhead spaces.

I bought this bag a month ago for a two week trip to Japan. The bag is bulky and looks bulky whether it's half full or almost full. Either way I was able to travel on various size planes with this bag in the overhead bin or under the seat. I didn't get questioned at the gate but I did get questioned on size when on the planes but I was able to prove that the bag fit in both the overhead bin and under the seat. Unfortunately if you get asked to check the size at the gate, it does not fit into the baggage checkers when it's packed. But it does fit the airline baggage requirements online. So keep in mind that you may be asked to check it if they ask you at the gate and make you use the baggage size checker. The two issues i had were the seams pulling apart and the anchor straps kept coming undone and id have to reset them. I was disappointed that the seams on the bag started to pull apart on my trip when it was the first trip i used it on. I wish the seams were reinforced for a more durable bag to travel with when it's almost full and more durable for a longer trip. Overall, it is a good travel bag but I don't think it's one to be used on a 2 week international trip almost fully packed which is why I bought it.
review.name: Good travel bag

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this bag and all the pockets. It has so much space but it isnt as bulky as other travel backpacks. I can't wait to use it on my trip to Japan! Also, thinking of ordering another one for my boyfriend for our trip, so we can be matching. After my travels, I will try to update this review. Only dislike is that I wasn't a huge fan of the brown color, I wish it still came in black or other colors.
review.name: Absolutely love ❤️

review.reviewBody: Bought for a weeklong trip to France and it worked great when moving from hostel to hostel and staying low profile in crowded cities. Could carry all the clothes and stuff I needed and pack up quickly, plus really easy to separate dirty and clean clothes. Would not use as a daypack just for walking around sightseeing but it is perfect as a quick compact luggage item.
review.name: Great mini-Luggage for trips

review.reviewBody: Used it for a 4 day surf trip to El Salvador. It had enough room for everything. Convenient compartments for organizing and keeping things neat. Comfortable to wear while full of stuff and a bit heavy. Only downside i came across is the water bottle holder does not hold a bottle secure, so when retrieving for the overhead bin my metal water bottle fell to the floor of the center aisle...really the only fault i could find. Only used for this one trip so far. Would recommend.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: This is a great traveling companion for those who like backpacks. The laptop holder and duel clothing storage make this a winner for me. I’ve used this as a carry-on for planes and snuck it under a seat when not paying for one ;). This bag is everything I needed and wanted when looking for a travel backpack.
review.name: Very wonderful for short stays.

review.reviewBody: Almost perfect.  The only thing I would add would be compression straps.  Everything else is perfect.
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Border Carry-On 40L Travel Backpack

review.reviewBody: Best boots I have ever purchased.  Wife is going to enjoy all my future Redwing purchases.
review.name: Iron Rangers

review.reviewBody:
This picture was immediately upon getting them, as you can see they are different colors, but also, if you look closer at the left boot you see a big crease. This is loose grain, and now that it’s been about 3 weeks it is DEEPLY creased while the right boot has hardly creased at all. 

So yeah, they are for sale on Facebook marketplace for 200 dollars because that’s all I’ll likely get for them. All 3 pairs of Red Wings I’ve purchased from backcountry I’m 99% sure are factory seconds OR red wings quality control has fallen off a cliff.
review.name: 4th pair from backcountry, and my last!!

review.reviewBody: I did a lot of research on which boots to buy, and these kept coming up. I love the attention to detail and the features in this boot. I also love the fact that my toes aren’t cramped anymore. If you were on the fence before, I wouldn’t hesitate if your sizes in stock
review.name: Everything I wanted it to be.

review.reviewBody: I have had this boot for a little over a year now. It has held up great. I plan on purchasing them in a black or suede color. The break in period was a little rough (about a week) but they are easily on my top 3 most comfortable boots I have ever worn.
review.name: My Favorite Set of Boots

review.reviewBody: Awesome boots. Copper Rough and Tough leather is amazing. Wear a size 9 in the 1907 Moc toe……8.5 in the ranger…..perfect fit! If you wear boots for a living, the break in is no problem, just put them on and go!
review.name: Classic, well made boot.

review.reviewBody: I think they’re really great. I think they should make some with black stitching as well and with a shiny black leather and as well as a matte black leather! But they are really great!
review.name: Great craftsmanship.
comment: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review on one of our products. We appreciate the honesty and are happy to hear you would recommend this boot.  Have a great day and thank you again for leaving your feedback!

review.reviewBody: Got a great price on these Iron Rangers, went half a size down from my adidas size (11 to 10.5). Fantastic quality and look, but the heels are horrible to break in. Highly recommend double-socking for the first few dozen miles. Don’t wear them fresh out of the box for an NYC walkabout like I did 😂
review.name: Great quality, tough break-in

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these boots.  They look as good in real life as they do in the photos.  I had previously owned two pairs of 1907s in a size 9 which fit perfectly, so I assumed a size 9 in the 8083s would too.  When I laced them up for the first time, I could hardly spread my toes and my foot felt very squeezed.  I figured this might be because they were brand new and just needed some breaking in.  But after a few months and I had to stop wearing them because they were literally cutting off circulation in my toes, causing them to tingle.  These feel WAY MORE TIGHT and NARROW than the 1907s.  Wish I had tried them on in a store before purchasing online.  I'm still a fan of the brand/craftsmanship, but I'll be avoiding Iron Rangers.
review.name: Quality Build, Poor Fit
comment: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots.   An email was sent to explain how we may be able to assist you with this issue.  Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
I could not be happier with my Pair of 8084 Black Harness Iron Rangers. Unlike most black boots, these stand out through their pops of white stitching and the brown welt leather, and the iconic silhouette makes for one hell of a boot. Mine have been worn around and abused a good amount already, and aside from creases, they still look practically new. 

The stitching isn't quite perfect in spots, but I don't believe an issue that only affects the look is a real issue at all. 

I rotate through my boots in order to keep the leather at their highest quality, but I mourn the days where I'm not wearing my Red Wings.
review.name: Durable, Yet Comfortable and Beautiful
comment: Thank you for the fantastic review! We're thrilled to hear you're loving your 8084 Iron Rangers. It's great that they're holding up so well and still looking sharp despite the wear. We appreciate your attention to detail and dedication to caring for your boots!

review.reviewBody: The craftsmanship of these boots are absolutely amazing I’ve been wearing mine everyday for work, hiking,Church and yard work averaging 20 thousand steps a day it is exactly what I was looking for in a boot a boot that I can work in and brush off and go to church in i highly recommend these boots to anyone who wants a high quality heritage boot that can do anything you throw at it
review.name: SUPERB BOOTS
comment: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review on one of our products. We appreciate the honesty and are happy to hear you would recommend this boot.  Have a great day and thank you again for leaving your feedback!
