review.reviewBody:
This is my first review ever. I purchased the helmet in the 2023-2024 season and enjoyed it until the BOA dial on the back broke. My previous Oakley helmet I used for three seasons, and the BOA dial worked perfectly.

Unfortunately, I bought this helmet from Backcountry.com, and my experience with their warranty process has been terrible. I submitted a claim 2.5 months ago, providing all the required images and a video of the broken part, following their guidelines. Despite this, I still haven't received a replacement or any response from customer support. I will never buy from this site again.
review.name: ZERO start to Backcountry
comment: Hey there, I'm sorry about the way the warranty process went here, we have sent you an email to make sure this gets resolved.

review.reviewBody: This is a great helmet if your head can fit inside.   Unfortunately, even at L/XL, I was having issues.   Pay close attention to "this item runs small" in the description, especially if during cold conditions,  you wear additional headwear under your helmet.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody:
So I have tried every helmet brand I can get my hands on. I have a narrow oval head shape and so far nothing has worked for me other than getting a helmet one size larger than I need that has a 360 boa adjustment and cranking it down to fit my torpedo noggin. Obviously this is t ideal and on this last attempt at research I saw this brand is as more narrow than others. 

The good things: this helmet brand is many levels better than any other brand I have tried (Smith, Anon, Giro, Sandbox, Poc, Oakley, and K2). I think the only brand I have yet to try is Atomic. The quality of this helmet is amazing, this particular style was really heavy but they are not all that way. I also did find Sweet Protection to truly run narrower than the rest. Still not narrow enough, but it’s getting closer. 

Now for the bad: this brand offers a “boa” adjustment in the back, unfortunately it is not a 360 system, it only adjust for the back half of the head. This doesn’t really help me since a half system located in the front to back plane of the head will only remove slack in the  long section of my head, I need the adjustment to be side to side or better yet, the whole circumference. The other thing about the adjustment is that it broke within 15 minutes of me trying the helmet on. I’m not sure if the ratchet knob came loose from the adjustment arms and it could be reset, but this was incredibly disappointing for the price point of this helmet. 

I sent the helmet back and tried a different style from this brand. So far, the other style hasn’t had any issues but I am nervous that it is a matter of time before the dial breaks too. Ultimately , this brand is still the best that I have found but I’m not completely convinced there isn’t a better helmet out there that I haven’t tried. Time will tell if this one makes me happy.
review.name: Good and bad

review.reviewBody:
Purchased the Trooper 2Vi Mips after purchasing the Switcher on a whim. Turns out the Switcher is designed for round heads. The Trooper fits oval-shaped heads (per recommendation from Sweet Protection). The dial adjustment on this helmet is stellar, but for some reason the Trooper does not ship with their padding kit (worth noting that the Switcher comes with their padding kit). I sent them a request through customer service and Sweet Protection sent me the padding kit free of charge—I've got the fit completely dialed in. 

My head measures 59cm—this is the limit of the medium helmet and I'm here to tell you that the medium won't fit a 59cm head. The large fits perfectly and does not require much to synch the fit into place. Measure your head to get the best fit. 

This is not a light helmet, but I never noticed it on the hill. It's built like a stylish tank. And you can buy replacement parts for the pieces that get the most use. 

The magnetic chin buckle is super easy to use, but the best feature of this helmet is the hollow ear pads—there's a pocket for your ear. No more smashed ear pain after a few hours. Better still, there's a pocket in the ear pad for speakers. Most speakers are way to thick and wind up feeling like bricks pressed against your head. This helmet will accommodate all brands, including thick speakers like Chips, Aleck, and Alta ... ALL are way too thick for my liking. I have the BE Headware speakers and they're brilliant (thinnest insert speakers on the market).

The only weird thing about the design is that there is a vent on the sides of the ear pads that allows air to pass through. When you're skiing it can sound like a wind tunnel ... and makes for some cold ears on a chilly day. Speakers will mitigate the noise and air conditioning, but I solved the problem by inserting a thin piece of foam in the ear pad pockets cut to cover the vent.

Rolls-Royce of ski helmets. Worth every penny.
review.name: Awesome Helmet

name: Trooper 2Vi Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a small, but according to other reviews it runs big, I ordered Small thinking that it will be a little bit bigger (oversized) but when sweater arrived it end up to be normal size and it's not a bigger on me. So I just wanted to say that it's true to size, and if I decide to order in different color I definitely order a medium for a oversized look, but I'm still keeping my small size
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: Bought as a gift for my mom and looks great on, very cozy. Will be really nice in the winter, it looks like it will be really warm.
review.name: Cozy sweater

review.reviewBody: Bought the sweater for my 93 year old mom! She is always cold! She doesn't leave the house much , so it's been nice for her to wear it everyday!
review.name: Kallie Cardigan

review.reviewBody: Love this sweater. Very soft and cozy. I need it other colors as well.
review.name: I would buy this product again in other colors

review.reviewBody: I love my sweater it runs bigger ..I wish I had a order amedium ..
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I was so disappointed. I purchased for my daughter for a Christmas present. It is too thin and the quality is poor. I believe UGGs should know better.
review.name: I would not recommend this product

review.reviewBody: My daughter had one and I loved it so much I bought one for myself!
review.name: Fabulous!

review.reviewBody: It arrived today and I'm disappointed. The material is thin, so I don't think it's going to keep me warm, and I think it looks cheap which is not what I expect at this price. In the past, I purchased another UGG cardigan (the Judith) and an UGG turtleneck (the Ylonda II) from this website in a similar fabric, but this cardigan's fabric is not the same as it seems to be an inferior quality. There are long threads at the seams that stick out, especially at the end of the sleeves and along the bottom. After I tried it on, I put my cell phone in the pocket and it made the front sag. That's one of my greatest criticisms of the UGG cardigans: pockets are large enough to hold a cell phone, but the fabric isn't strong enough to sustain holding one without major sagging. I don't care for the fit either because it's oversized in the armpit area, and the sleeves get wider from the elbow down which make the part around my wrists sag as if it were a bell sleeve. I used the size chart, but I think the sizing would have been better if I had sized down.
review.name: I'm returning it

hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM GXP BB92 Bottom Bracket online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
For the price, this is a good solution.  That said, I'm not built like a typical bike so putting a lot of torque and weight on this bottom bracket result in a lot of creaking noice due to movement.  I replaced my original bottom bracket with one of these earlier this summer and it only lasted a couple months before the creaking got too annoying.  I stepped up to the Wheels MFG threaded option to make it more secure and have had no problems or extra noise.  

https://www.competitivecyclist.com/wheels-mfg-bb86-92-sram-bottom-bracket-with-abec-3-bearings-whl000q'skidn=WHL000Q-BK-ONESIZ&ti=UExQIENhdDpCaWtlIEJvdHRvbSBCcmFja2V0czoxOjc6Y2NDYXQxMDA0NjY=
review.name: Good, but not great

review.reviewBody: Bought to replace a Smith helmet that I cracked, which I believe is the same model. It fits slightly smaller than my old one
review.name: Works

review.reviewBody:
I used it three times. Then the chin strap broke i.e., the male half of the connector came off somehow. I am now using my old helmet. I tried looking for replacement part but it is not easy to find. I do enjoy Smith products and bought all four kids Smith ski helmets and Smith ski goggles along with my new ski helmet and bike helmet this year but I am not sure I will buy Smith gear again due to my helmet sucking. 

Is there a way to get a replacement helmet? I added a photo with my Smith helmet with broken chin strap along with a picture skiing this season with my old helmet.
review.name: Chin Strap Broke on Day #3 - Not Happy

review.reviewBody: Only got to wear it once before it was stolen 😞 so sad
review.name: Only got to wear it

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet! Fits my head perfectly, as Smith helmets tend to do. It’s super light, and integrates really well with my Smith goggles. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great helmet.

review.reviewBody: First ski helmet that I've bought and couldn't be happier. I measured my head and was in between small and medium --- initially buying a small but had to return for a medium to allow room for my balaclava. It is lightweight, but breaths. Feels and fits great!
review.name: First ski helmet that I've

review.reviewBody: Solid helmet with a great fit/integration with Smith Squad Mag Googles. MIPS makes the helmet fit smaller than advertised, but this was OK for me. If you are at the upper end of the size limit, be wary. Pretty warm, which is great for our cloudy midwest days. Earmuffs definitely make it harder to hear people talking to you.
review.name: A solid helmet with clean fit/intregration with Smith Googles

review.reviewBody: I ordered this for my grand son for Christmas. The large Altus fit him perfectly and he loves it. He is an avid snow boarder.
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, snug-fitting helmet. There are fancier options, but this helmet gets the job done and is comfortable all day.
review.name: Comfortable, snug-fitting helmet. There are

review.reviewBody: Gift for my son. He’s currently skiing in Taos. Said helmet is perfect. Comfortable. Fits great.
review.name: Gift for my son. He’s

review.reviewBody:
After using this helmet for just over one season I noticed something digging into my right ear. Upon investigating I found the end of the adjustment mechanism had pulled out of the anchor point in the helmet. I put it back in but it will not stay in place. Not a good design. 
My old helmet is over 20 years old and is still serviceable. I just thought I would update and maybe be more safe and comfortable. ???
review.name: Problem

name: Altus Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: It’s a good product and idea, Could be a little bit better, by adding a few more optional Bolt locations.
review.name: Could be better

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality, fit and finish.  Multiple mounting options, well thought out design.
review.name: Perfect match to the 1 gallon jug.

review.reviewBody: Does what it says it will do. installed it in my car to keep it from rolling around and now im worried free. the quality the product picture does it no justice. this mount is built yeti strong.
review.name: Top line Carseat Quality

review.reviewBody: The jug mount is a perfect fit for the 1/2-gallon Yeti and is a must have. I already mounted the jug mount to my 4-wheeler cargo rack by using the included screws, washers and lock nuts. It looks great and is extremely functional.
review.name: Must have for a 4-wheeler or tractor.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for holding the jug in place in a drift boat.
review.name: Holder

review.reviewBody: Love it only one thing could make it a lil better.I mounted it on my atv because space is limited and i didnt want to mount a big cooler on it because if the way i use it. I think yeti should make a optional quick disconnect so you can move the mount from one vehicle to the next without having to buy multiple mounts
review.name: Worth it!

review.reviewBody: Very well made and strong, not a cheap plastic and come with good hardware too
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: Essential for mobile stowage - enables me to quickly put my jug in multiple places and keep it from rolling around in the vehicle.  has four screw mount points for vertical and base fastening. Rugged and jug slips in easily.  For those that sticker the jug, still slides in w/o destroying.
review.name: Essential for mobile stowage

review.reviewBody: I have bought several of these - One for every truck I drive, on my ranger, and on the boat. I consider it a necessity for hauling my Yeti Jug around. I bring my Yeti Jug with me everyday of the week and this helps me transport it and keep it from rolling around. I love this mount.
review.name: It’s a Necessity

review.reviewBody: I love this mount . It works perfect mounted in my 4Runner while off-roading. I plan on getting a second setup like this.
review.name: Perfect holder

name: Rambler Jug Mount

description: Buy the Specialized Fast Trak Grid 2Bliss T7 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fast Trak Grid 2Bliss T7 29in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Fast Trak Grid 2Bliss T7 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve ridden these tires 3 times so far. Twice on legit single track and once on gravel trails with about 2” of snow. They rolled fast over the snow and had enough bite to feel confident on punchy uphills. Had some trouble getting them to seal up but once they did they’ve held air like a champ. Recommended psi min. is 29lbs. But I’ve been running them at 25 and have had no problem. For the money a good fast rolling tire.
review.name: Dramatic pneumatic

review.reviewBody:
I?ve been running the old version Fast  
Controls 60tpi that came stock and now have been using the new Fast Traks. I have the Control T5 for the rear and Grid T7 in the front. The new ones appear to have a little more knob to them but I don?t notice any slower rolling resistance. The T7 is a little softer and does better on roots/rocks. They are very predictable tires and are my go to for mixed terrain when I still want to go fast. I used this setup for the Marji Gesick 100 in Michigan and seemed to be the best balance of grip and speed. No punctures and $30 cheaper than Maxxis and Schwalbe.
review.name: XC with Grip

name: Fast Trak Grid 2Bliss T7 29in Tire

review.reviewBody:
I had been wearing slippers that offered orthotic support, but they were not particularly warm, and they made my feet stink. Oooooeeee did they stink! Plus, they made my feet sweat, which made them cold. What was the point?
 Then I saw these slippers. It was almost love at first sight, but I am allergic to wool.  I clung to the hope that I would be able to wear it anyway.  is it possible that boiled or felted wool removes the lanolin? I kept all the packaging and wore them only while sitting down so as not to make them unsaleable if I had to return them, but as soon as I put them on, I was in love. They do not cause an allergic reaction for me, and they are everything a slipper should be.  As a matter of fact,  I've almost stopped leaving my house because I don't want to put real shoes on.  It's only a problem if my family wants to eat, and I'm trying to wean them from that. Cozy, odor free, surprisingly supportive, and I've already gifted another pair to my sister.
review.name: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE

review.reviewBody:
These are, hands down, the best cold weather around the house slippers. You can wear them all day.

I'm usually someone who requires a bunch of arch support. My summer house shoes are always crocs and my feet love them. When I first put on these, I expected them to be too flat for all day wear, but they have been perfect.

I also expected them to end up with feeling bad without socks, but they've been both comfy and not at all an unpleasant smell.

The soles are obviously not waterproof and they will darken and stain as they are used, but they haven't become slick, so they are still nice and grippy to walk around in.

All in all, durable, warm, and comfy, without any annoying bits.
review.name: So Comfy!

review.reviewBody: Love these. I normally suffer from what my family endearingly refers to as "sweat foot." No shoe is safe. I normally go through slippers all.the.time because they just stink. What can I say, I am gross. Regardless, I have worn these all day, every day for two weeks and they smell fantastic!!! The foot is warm but can breathe. I think this may be the end of sweat foot for me! Shoe size 7.5, got the 38.
review.name: Buy these now
comment: Hey Emily, have you ever tried ozonated lotion or olive oil for your feet? It can really help with the 'smell'.

review.reviewBody: I wore these around the house for a few hours. They are SUPER cozy, but I decided to switch to the slip ons for easier sliding on and off.
review.name: Very cozy

review.reviewBody: My first Glerups purchase, and I'm hooked. Comfortably warm with an insole that feels incredible (and makes them worth every penny). For reference, I wear a Womens US 12M / EU 44. True to size, a 44 fits perfectly. I go sockless, but if you prefer to wear them, you may find the fit a bit snug.
review.name: Believe the hype.

review.reviewBody: Yes, they are a splurge for slippers...but they are entirely worth it! So warm, so comfortable, so stylish. Thinking about getting the rubber soled version just so I can wear them out since they look that good! I'm usually a 9.5, sometimes a 10. IMO they run a bit small. I ordered the 9.5 and exchanged for the 10 which was much more comfortable.
review.name: Worth it!

review.reviewBody: I laughed when I opened the box containing my latest Glerups purchase. Printed on the box..."Warning! Addictions can occur." This was the seventh pair I'd purchased. I got my first pair 5 years ago when we moved to a home that had all (chilly) hardwood and tile floors. I instantly fell in love and purchased a pair for four other family members the following Christmas. This year, I am gifting a pair to our latest addition to the family, my daughter's fianc°. And I replaced my original pair. Worn nearly constantly for 3 seasons of the 5 years I've had them, they are wearing thin where my little toes like to stretch out. The soles are still completely intact, and the stitching is solid. I won't discard these old gray booties, but will wear them when I work in the basement or on days when I am likely to also step outside to the garage...cleaning and household chores days. I am already enjoying my new denim blue booties on my usual work-from-home days in my usual uniform of leggings and tunics. I am officially addicted. Love them!
review.name: Addicted to Glerups

review.reviewBody:
The only part of the size chart you should pay attention to are the first two columns. I made the mistake of ordering my size based on my foot measurement in mm, which gave me a slipper whose toe box brushed right up against my feet. Weird, since on that chart the measurement corresponds with my typical EU size. Exchanging those for the next size up, Glerups' equivalent to my typical US shoe size, was the better way to go-- the slippers are as cozy and comfy as everyone has already said. 

It's puzzling why Glerups converts their EU sizes to a smaller US size than most other shoe brands. An EU 46 should convert to a 13, but Glerups for some reason sizes their 46s to fit a 12. But yeah, go with the Glerups equivalent to your US size and disregard everything else and the comfort shall be yours.
review.name: Go with your US size

I can say with confidence that trying them on for the very first time I was quite surprised by their comfort, quality, and clarity. These are fantastic aviators, and getting polarized lenses at this price turned be into a Smith believer. Well done A++

description: Buy the Elite Suito T Interactive Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Suito T Interactive Trainer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Suito T Interactive Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used this trainer for a couple of seasons now. I only use it in the winter months, when it's too cold and snowy to bike outside. This trainer feels very stable and I've never had a problem connecting it to Zwift. You do have to buy a separate cassette that works for your bike, but can't really complain about that since it is a direct connect trainer. Truly a great trainer and worth the investment - whether you want to do structured training programs with Zwift or just train during the winter months.
review.name: Great Trainer!

review.reviewBody:
Really love Backcountry/Competitive Cyclist but they should not be selling this piece of junk. 
-flywheel too light
-unstable 
-cheap electronics and software design
-will not calibrate resistance correctly on any incline !!! It will either be WAY to much or almost none at all on a steep grade. We are talking largest cog in back and small ring in front trying to get past the resistance or small cog in back and big ring in front looking to try and get some load !
-after about 30 minutes of use you most likely will start hearing a rattling sound 
-Italian customer service responds but they will blame eveything except their machine or ask you to take it apart and send pictures of the magnets in motion or look for loose parts !
-if you want a great trainer at a reasonable price point with great customer service try the Wahoo Kickr Core (btw, their flywheel is 11.9 lbs vs 7.7 of this machine. And it matters !
review.name: Junk run away do your research

review.reviewBody: Rode trainer three times using the My E-training app and the magnet locked up on the hardest resistance. Emailed Elite tech support, two days later they responded. Tech requested I take a video of magnet operation. Tech stated circuit board had a defective driver. Elite tech will be mailing me a new circuit board that I have to install. * note* it seems that you can only email them. Contacted Backcountry for a return and was told I have to return to Elite. Needless to say I'm not very satisfied..
review.name: Suito-T trainer

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this trainer for about a year and a half and it's been solid overall. I haven't had any stability issues just make sure the outrigger legs are locked in place. I've never had any pairing problems either and have even updated the firmware a couple of times. 

As mentioned in another review the "Upgrado" app is pretty bad but other than initial setup and firmware updates I've never needed it. 

If you're interested in using Zwift or similar this is a great trainer.
review.name: Great smart trainer

review.reviewBody: The Suito Elite is a high end mid-range trainer...if that makes sense. Unless you are competing on the pro circuit, it has all you'll need. Don't waste your money on a trainer that can produce watts you'll never produce. I am an avid mtn biker and occasional roadie. But I am not a pro cyclist. Producing 600-700 watts is a big deal for me, and not sustainable. Buying a machine that can produce more than 1900 watts is a waste of money. I don't use the Suito app (other than for calibration); its interface is not intuitive and clumsy. Connected to Zwift, the trainer is great. Re the wobble per another post, learn to adjust the feet. It's simple. Perhaps don't use it on floor tile that does not offer a smooth surface. I had no wobble issue with the drive. An added benefit, its smaller size folds up and can slide under a bed. This machine is being discontinued; buy it while available as a value.
review.name: A value...you won't need more

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
-Good price
-portable
-simple to use

Cons:
- Unstable, there is flex in the legs and in the unit when I was using it. 
- Quite a bit of wobble in the drive wheel

Purchased this trainer as it is one of the few currently compatible with the 2021+ emonda. Unfortunately it has quite a bit of wobble when using it. I think it stems from its adjustable feet and from the unit itself. I also noticed quite a bit of wobble in the drive wheel which could be felt when pedaling. Overall I think it would be great for a smaller rider. Returned it and ordered  the Saris H3.
review.name: Wobble

name: Suito T Interactive Trainer

description: Buy the The North Face Tadpole SL Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tadpole SL Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Tadpole SL Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: With an enticing sale and a personal history with the Tapdpole line, I was excited for this tent. I would have ordered the footprint but it was out of stock. I used the tent one night in light, low country terrain. Woke up to two holes in the floor. It seems there was a weight to durability issue. When I reported the issue to Jessica with Backcountry they made it right immediately. I have always appreciated their customer service. I was also informed they could not get the footprint in and that they were phasing the tent out. So I chose to return the tent for store credit.
review.name: Phased Out

review.reviewBody: After setting up this tent in my backyard as a test, I have not used it in the field and do not expect to. I really wanted to like this tent but the design has me scratching my head on why didn't TNF make the brow pole an exterior pole. If you are going to set this up while it is raining and you are by yourself, expect to be soaked by the time you get that pole in place. At least I would expect to get soaked. TNF, it is over a year, but please take this tent and footprint back as a return. I have purchased a few TNF tents (Boulder / original Tadpole) and they were the best tents in all kinds of conditions - for years.
review.name: More frustrating to set-up than I thought.

review.reviewBody: It's only little over 2 pounds and stood up against hurricane like thunderstorm and it's warm in the cold too. They market it a three season but you can definitely take this on super cold nights. Setup is crazy fast and easy. The material they used to make this is VERY durable. I forgot my footprint and for 10 nights didn't get one hole or anything. I was dry the entire time, no leaks at all. I believe this is the redesign. A lot of effort was put into the engineering for this monster tent. I don't think I'll ever get another tent. If you're hiking a long ways and need something lightweight and durable this is what you get hands-down. Light weight, warm and resilient. Don't mess around. For what you're paying for this is the absolute best deal on the planet. Get this lightweight monster. Thank you Northface
review.name: Best tent for the price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was really excited about this tent due to its light trail weight, but wish I never bought it. I used it on 2 separate trips. As mentioned by others setting up the internal arch pole is tricky because it doesn't click in anywhere and is very difficult to wrestle into place, but that's not why I rate this tent so poorly.. Single wall construction tents just don't breathe well and even in dry conditions! On my first trip condensation builds up on the inside walls of the tent overnight soaking everything inside. On my second and last trip with this tent I was at Sequoia NP and it rained both nights, the walls are not waterproof at all and everything inside the tent got soaked, the floor kept water out but as the tent absorbed more water it started to run down the sides and pool on the floor. Don't buy this tent, or any single wall construction tent unless you like sleeping in a sec bag!
review.name: Worst TNF tent I have ever owned!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great tent. Light, spacious, and kept me dry in the rain.
review.name: I would buy this tent again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great single wall for light weight. Breathable. Archway carbon pole troublesome to set up and seat in reinforced corners (see pic). Tend to creep out and puncture bottom tub. Happened twice now. -2 stars.
review.name: Great 3S single wall. Just needs a little design tweek.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this product and took it on a weekend backpacking trip into the Wind River Range in Wyoming. It was wonderfully light to carry. For setup, it was a little difficult to place the front "arch" pole, as you have to place this tent inside the tent to secure it, but doable with a friend. This tent does not have a rainfly, and I was excited about the idea of a waterproof single-layer tent. Unfortunately we experienced storms with moderate rainfall, and the "waterproofing" did not hold up. By the second day of our trip, the inside of my tent was soaking wet, and a small puddle formed on the floor of my tent. This water appeared to be coming in through the walls of the tent (not condensation). TNF Customer Service was wonderful about sending me a return label & issuing me a refund. If you are camping somewhere where rain is unlikely, this is a great, light tent. Unfortunately this tent did not work for me.
review.name: Very light, but sadly not waterproof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy setup light weight perfect for kayak camping or bike camping
review.name: This is my second

review.reviewBody:
I slept 19 nights in this tent, temps of exposure between 40 and 98 F (4 and 37 C), two t-storms with torrential rainfall, and one night with a strong side wind.
Pros: This is the largest 2-person tent I have seen in decades. It is very light, packs small, and it dries fast. It didn't leak even once and only on one morning I had a little condensation on the lower wall. The poles are light and finally TNF installed quality shock cords. With the improvements I mentioned below, it will be an ideal friend for long backpacking or mountaineering trips. 
Minor cons: the color shows dirt very quickly, the thin floor fabric is a subject to a quick deterioration, the front door zippers open only one way, from down up - the vertical zipper, and front left to right - the horizontal one, and this feature makes the ventilation process of the tent harder. The vestibule zipper gets caught in the overflowing sleeve all the time. From a $550 tent, I would expect a waterproof zipper that doesn't need additional protection.
Major cons: the lengthwise pole that goes on the outside of the tent has both ends of the same, small size, which is a mistake. The one that goes into the sleeve should be definitely thicker. As you can see in the photo below, the pole will poke a hole in the fabric soon. The biggest flaw in the design is the width-wise/across pole that goes inside the tent. This pole must be re-designed and placed on the outside of the tent to make the final product functional. The pole is held in place inside by 5 Velcro straps. The Velcros are NOT able to keep the pole in the designated position  and the pole is constantly sliding down the tent - photos attached. The top Velcro is slowly pulling away the seal from the seam so it will cause the tent leak soon. It is very time consuming to place the pole and while doing it, you need to keep the door open, so if it's raining, you will get rain inside the tent no matter how hard you try to avoid it. I pitched the tent after the sunset once, and immediately had dozens of bugs attracted by my headlamp flying inside the tent. I can't imaging pitching the tent in really windy conditions.  
Finally, if TNF makes the suggested changes, I will take this tent back. Otherwise, it is a return.  
P.S. I can't place all the photos of the tent I have. Backcountry people, any suggestion?
review.name: A really nice tent but it goes back

name: Tadpole SL Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I have been buying these for years. I have severe flat feet and had professional orthotics before getting these. I do not need the orthotics with these and I wear the shoes daily.
review.name: I keep buying them

review.reviewBody: These walkers look good and are quite comfortable.  I think the comfort will increase as they break in some.  They feel the slightest bit big and clunky but I think breaking in will help this too.  I am size 13.  The biggest gripe, which is very small, is that they have a small sole squeak when walking on a smooth hard surface (wood floor, etc.).  I would buy again.
review.name: Good looking and comfortable

review.reviewBody: The Addiction Walker 2 shoes have been my preferred walking shoe for over 10 years. They are very comfortable and provide the support my feet need. I can wear the shoe all day long without experiencing fatigue or discomfort.
review.name: The Best Walking Shoe

review.reviewBody: The shoe is a nice fit, but it is really stiff and not a very good running shoe in my opinion. Ican only use it for walking, but it is still not a very flexible material.
I got these shoes for walking only. I have only had them a very short time, but so far like them very much. Will see how long they last. Thats the real story.
review.name: Good walking shoes for seniors

review.reviewBody: I have neuropathy very bad in both feet and my Dr told me to wear Brooks. I find that the fit is very comfortable on my feet because anything too tight or too small causes the neuropathy pain to intensify. Brooks also makes high quality shoes and I’d highly recommend this product. I would like to see some variety in the colors offed in the Addiction line. I’ve only seen black or white offered.
review.name: Addition 2 by Brooks

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoe- great for walking and everyday wear.  Would like the option to have the previous tread since the current tread allows sand and dirt to be trapped and tracked in from outside.

Very comfy shoe and I use it as a work shoe as the RED WINGS caused my Achilles pain to come back as they did not have the heel drop like this shoe does. I needed a leather shoe for work and this fits the bill and has help my Achilles pain start to go away. The only think thatI would like better is the slip of the sole it is not really slip resistant like they say it is so if they fix that it will be a good work shoe!!!
review.name: Addiction Walker 2 nice show needs to be better slip resistant!

review.reviewBody: For the new trainers they feel comfortable and look nice. I never used this brand before but I think it will become my next one. They are not the softest ones but are still comfortable. With softer insoles they are fine. I recommend them
These shoes give me blisters.  Over the years I have worn New Balance, Nike and Vionic with no problems.  But these shoes have caused painful blisters to form on my arches.
review.name: Painful blisters

name: Addiction Walker 2 Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the GSI Outdoors Mini-Espresso Maker Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mini-Espresso Maker Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the GSI Outdoors Mini-Espresso Maker Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My husband and I prefer espresso drinks over a cup of coffee which is fine at home but it's hard to make espresso when traveling or camping. This is such a great solution, small compact and light weight and makes good espresso wherever we go!

Up your camping/ travel coffee game and get one!
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody:
An excellent way to start the morning, whether for the office or in the backcountry (is not a compact device) or just for the excuse of enjoying a delicious coffee.
Quality materials, including the case. GSI, you did it again...
review.name: Rocket Fuel!

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd GSI espresso maker (I left one on the stove too long and burned it, I smashed the other into my backpack and broke the stem).  I love this coffee!  We call it "jet fuel".  It is heavy for backpacking, I am not doing week long hundred milers, hikes in to the Black Canyon for a couple days of fishing.  It is worth it to me to carry this weight, although with this I do not have to carry a way to boil water.  It does take a few times to figure out how to make the best cup.  This is arguably my favorite part of camping, espresso riverside!
review.name: Great double shot
comment: Ok... Now I want It!

name: Mini-Espresso Maker Set

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband was so pleased with his boots that I gifted him for Christmas. He flies charter helicopters here in AK, so the warmth and durability of the boot really drew him to this pair. He can’t wait to test them out!
review.name: Amazing fit!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a fit and active worker but have a hard time staying warm, especially in my extremities. These boots are keeping my feet warm without fancy thick socks during full days when the temperature stayed in the teens. At the same time they're not so clunky and oversized to keep me from getting around the farm easily.
review.name: Warm feet

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I went a size bigger. Boots I bought from you in October ran small. . A bit roomy so I put some inserts in an they fit better. Very comfortable. It would be nice if you made 1/2 sizes.
review.name: Polar boots

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not very comfortable and pinched at the ankle. Returned them for the lower version, they’re much better
review.name: Not very comfortable and pinched

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm and comfortable right out of the box. I went with the size recommendation from keen and the fit is perfect with thick socks.
review.name: Warm and comfortable right out

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: He loves these boots. Great fit, warm, great traction
review.name: He loves these boots. Great

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] not confident about the -40 rating ; wearing outside in + 20 degrees w/ carhart heavy socks shoveling snow ; 40 minutes --my feet were getting cold 
maybe change the cold rating claim to zero
review.name: nice Hi top boot

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Followed the sizing advice and bumped my normal 10 to a 10. 5! Perfect!
review.name: Great Boot!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
No more brace. We were looking for a high top boot that would support his bowed ankle due to paraplegia, we are pleased with the support. We wanted the added insulation due to cold feet and it has helped. We were concerned about not having enough room for the toesies but they run wide. We were concerned that his high arch would not allow him to get the boot on, but it was not an issue.
We were concerned about fluoride issues because toxic socks was what was given him red and swollen feet but because Keen boots are PFAS free, that's not an issue. You can see from the unsolicitated photos that he is thrilled!!! Thank you Keen Boots
review.name: He is thrilled!!!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Tried to break these in short snow trail hikes. Left boot is uncomfortable at ankle/tongue region causing pinching pain on inside left shin. I even tried wearing very ultra thick socks but it did not alleviate the discomfort.
review.name: Great boot but left boot uncomfortable/pinching at ankle/tongue area

name: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great jacket!  Super comfy.  Perfect fit.  Great color!
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody: Love this down hoody. I purchased in the wild oyster...yes, you can see the feathers, but it feels intentional. Would have given 5 stars...but the logo is in black, not white/light colored as shown in the pictures. I really wanted a logo that blended in. However, it's a great jacket. I am 5' 7' and 135lbs. The small fits nicely. I can wear a wool sweater underneath without issue, but there is not a ton of layering room. I bought it to fit this way. The sleeves hit at my wrists...I could have sized up to a medium, but I wanted a close fitting down jacket. I have worn with jeans and dress pants. It is pretty unassuming and looks good.
review.name: Warm, love the wild oyster color

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this for two months now and it’s amazing. I got on sale for only 100 bucks and it’s so warm. I wear a windbreaker on top on extra cold days and it’s the perfect down layer. Quality is great I have never bought this brand before but it’s been great. Also had this on while it was raining and it held up great. I just had to shake it for the water droplets to come off!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Wish this worked… it’s so comfy feeling but nowhere near an XL
review.name: Small

review.reviewBody:
I actually love the fit and look of this puffer. It is a bit puffier than a nano and would be a bit awkward under another jacket or sweater, unless you had a big shell to put over it. My main issue is that the sleeves are a bit short, I think they're shorter than the size guide as well. I have a 6 foot wingspan and these only go to an inch before my wrist. Really comfy fit and very cute otherwise.
I also got the largest size and it fits just perfectly, not baggy and no option to go bigger. I am quite thin, although very tall so I feel like there should be some larger options.
review.name: Long arms, sleeves too short

name: Tiberondack Down Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: Searching for a bag to be used as my "purse", and work items (a small binder, smoothie bottle, etc) I found the Fjallraven reKanken. It's the perfect size, gorgeous color, and I love the fact that it's made of recycled plastic bottles! I'm now a Fjallraven lover, and will be purchasing more of their stuff. It's great, quality, the attention to detail and design makes for really awesome products. Will absolutely be a return customer.
review.name: First Fjallraven product purchase....

review.reviewBody: i’ve had this bag for 5 years now and it’s still in pristine shape. it’s the perfect school bag and fits more than expected. once i’m not in school, i can see myself using it for short trips and camping since it’s so versatile. the re-kanken is such high quality and i intend to use it for many years to come.
review.name: amazing investment

review.reviewBody: I got this as a Christmas present 5 years ago. I wear it every day heavy duty use and still like new! Never gets wet when l got caught in the rain and even when is small fits so many things in there. Also is absolutely cute.
review.name: My everywhere/ everyday best friend

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a Rekanken for 6 years now. It looks brand new , I usually throw it in my laundry. Holds up very well. It has aged beatifully. I adore this backpack. Huge fan of the brand now because of this backpack. Never had a backpack that lasted so long it such great condition. Because it lasted so long , I bought the rekanken mini, for smaller version, the kanken No 2 for my laptop, the weekender qhich is awesome as a carry on even at airports, the sling which I use as a purse and the tote for groceries and stuff. I only use fjallraven now , cause you can never go wrong. It is made to last !! Also I feel like is very stylish , I only wear black and only hace the boack ones , the color hasn’t faded. Make sure to wash it every now and then in delicate warm cycle or by hand.  I love that it doesn’t take any space, and is super light.  I am surprised that for such small and simple handles they haven’t torn. I gave away any other backpack or bags that are not this brand , this is by far the comfiest, classiest and best. If I end up buying a new backpack ever again , it would be this same exact one just to renew, althought I have a feeling it can literally last a decade more , impressive Fjallraven.
review.name: My favourite Backpack for life

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a laptop Kanken for a while which I love, but it’s bright orange. I brought a grey re-kanken as a toned down version for work. This is no where near as good as the original. The material is stiff and quite noisy when walking around with pack on. It just feels low quality too compared with my other one. It also has less features than my other pack. My first one has useful pockets inside and is nicely lined. The re-kanken doesn’t have any of this. If the sustainability credentials are important to you then re-kanken is an acceptable back pack. If you’re not too bothered about green credentials the original is much better!!
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I love this bag. I've used it as my daily work bag to carry my laptop, overnight bag for short trips, and adventure bag (for hikes with my shiba). It does seem to attract my dog's fur, but it's not super noticeable. The side pockets aren't really big enough to hold most water bottles because they're flat pockets, but they work well for quick access items like sunglasses and snacks. I've been using it consistently for 6 months now and the color hasn't faded at all. I only wish they made other items with the same deep purple color.
review.name: LOVE the deep purple

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for over a year now and it has aged perfectly. I love everything from the design to the size. It's the perfect bag for everyday use, hiking, etc. The only thing to be weary of is that the recycled polyester material can sometimes get linty if that bothers you, but when it does I just use a lint roller. Highly recommend.
review.name: Favorite Bag

review.reviewBody: Cómoda sin mucha carga, el logo bordado es un puntazo. Ideal para verano
review.name: Cubre expectativas

review.reviewBody: El material es ligero y tiene buena capacidad para uso diario, además es un producto respetuoso con el planeta. Ganaría mucho si las correas estuviesen acolchadas.
review.name: Una ayuda al medioambiente

review.reviewBody: Had my eye on this backpack for years. Unfortunately i find it a little stiff and not as user friendly as I assumed. Overall ok, but had I been able to use before purchasing I think I would have passed.
review.name: Wanted one for a long time.

name: Re-Kanken 16L Backpack

description: Buy the Old Town Loon 126 Angler Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Loon 126 Angler Kayak
hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Loon 126 Angler Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Kayaks are absolutely incredible. But both came with major deep scratches and one came with a deep gash in the side of the hull. When they came off the truck they were only wrapped in plastic. No protection whatsoever around the hulls. Also, we did not get the Kayak locking lids that go on the back of the Loons. We got the lid that is held down by ropes. I am disappointed for sure about this because we spent almost 3K on everything and I would expect to get something a with a little more damage control effort. Makes me weary of buying from here again. Customer service is helping me through the situation now and they're easy to talk to about it. But it still can't change the fact the above has already happened after waiting two weeks for these boats. :(
review.name: Disapointed

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this kayak.  I use it for hunting. Decoys in the back hatch and the dog on top.  Hunting bag up front with the shotgun at the ready!  Super comfortable and has plenty of room without being too large.  Handles very well even with my dog on the back. The rigid but lightweight polylink hull is awesome.
review.name: Loon Hunter

review.reviewBody: I am pretty much a novice however I could not be more pleased with it. Plenty of room and storage, comfortable, durable, well balanced and glides effortlessly. My brother in law has a Vapor and there is no doubt this is a better yak in all aspects (extra money well spent). If I had one complaint, it does not track as well as one would hope.
review.name: Cuts through the water nicely

review.reviewBody: Purchase during Labor Day, had them delivered to Phoenix within 8 days. Took them to the large lakes and found they perform very well. Great products by a great company
review.name: Excellent Kayaks

review.reviewBody: Bought this kayak a couple of weeks ago.  Shipping and customer service was fast and extremely friendly.  This is quite an upgrade from my other kayaks.  I would definitely recommend it.  It tracks well, is stable and very fast compared to my 10' kayaks.  My only regret is that I didn't purchase it at the beginning of the summer, but I am still looking forward to a fantastic fall of kayaking and fishing. You won't be disappointed!
review.name: Awesome kayak

review.reviewBody: Tracking is great seat is very comfortable paddle holder and anchor were nice additions
review.name: Everything you need in a fishing kayak

name: Loon 126 Angler Kayak

review.reviewBody: The MOST comfortable clogs I own. The price is amazing and they are truly so comfortable. BUY!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these. My only complaint is that I left them on my porch one afternoon, and they shrank a good half size. I still love them, but the fit is definitely off now. I can no longer fit socks in them. I'm not sure if the plastic is different on these, but I haven't had this issue before.
review.name: Beware the sun shrink!

review.reviewBody: Confortable and sturdy. Easy to clean but they run small. My left foot is a size 8 and my right foot is 7 1/2. I got the size 8 and they fit my right foot perfectly. My left foot is on edge. I like to have extra room so I always size up. I suggest to size up or try on in store
review.name: Runs a tiny bit small

review.reviewBody: The shoes are amazing! I get lots of compliments on them.
review.name: New favorites!

description: Buy the Eureka! Summer Pass 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Summer Pass 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Summer Pass 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have only yard camped to try this out; it packs very compact and is lightweight, easy to assemble and to take apart. The tent is well constructed and is very airy for camping in Florida summer nights if you have clear weather and leave the fly off. With the fly on there is plenty of air flow while keeping out the elements.
review.name: A Roomy Tent For One or Two People

review.reviewBody: The tent arrived on time, but one of the poles was 20” shorter than the rest. I contacted eureka and expert voice. Eureka sent me new poles, but they would not be here by a camping trip I had planned to use the tent for. It seems like a great tent. I’ll just have to use it on another trip.
review.name: Manufacturing issue

review.reviewBody: This tent is ideal for my son camping alone or sharing the tent with me or one of his buddies.  Two vestibules make it convenient for storing your gear, especially in humid environments.  Full mesh walls and ceiling make for a comfortable night with the large amount of ventilation.  The wide entry way on both doors allow for easy in and out of the tent.  Take down is quick and simple.  Its lightweight design makes for a comfortable hike from the truck to the campsite.  It’s also easy to strap on to your backpack.  You can’t mess up on the set up with the color coded system.  Even still, crossing the colors will allow for the rain fly to install and operate the same.
review.name: Fast set up, great features!

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd Eureka 3 man. The first lost it’s waterproof coating after 9 hard camping years. The pass 3 is similar in size, weight and design . I feel it is harder to set up. The older model had 2 separate poles where as the pass 3 has one modular pole system that connects to a center hub which adds more weight and complexity to the tent. Also the plastic tab on the center hub that attaches to the peak of the tent was already broken. The fly and tent guy lines are not easily tied to the same stake like my older tent was. Also, the floor saver does not extend into the vestibule area to add as a external floor covering to store gear on under cover. I would not recommend this as a backpacking tent unless shared by 3 people who also share its weight of  6+ lbs amongst each other. I set this tent up once but chose to Re waterproof and  bring my 41 year old Eddie Bauer 2 man tent and shed that extra 4 lbs of weight. I would only recommend this tent for truck camping for young couples with one small child.I believe it is a very durable, comfortable tent for light Truck camping or for Scouting camps.
review.name: Roomy tent for 2 Adults and maybe a small child.

review.reviewBody: Love this tent easy to set up and very well made. Ventaltion is good plenty of pockets to store stuff. I am a happy camper thank you
review.name: Eureka delivers

review.reviewBody: I purchased  this a month or so ago but unfortunately I have not had the opportunity to use it. I have however set it up and checked it out and I am extremely impressed with the summer pass 3. I will update this review in the future when I am able to a thorough review.
review.name: Great product and customer service

review.reviewBody:
I have had this tent for a few months now and have been able to get it out on two different trips and a couple of backyard testing ventures. I bought this tent hoping to use it for car camping with my wife and dog, and hoping it would be light enough for some short
backpacking adventures. The size is adequate for the three of us (60 lb dog), perfect for just 
 the two of us (me and wife, or me and dog), and is downright roomy for a solo venture. The design is so that it allows for extra headroom, which is accomplished by the use of an extra pole and a somewhat difficult to get used to zipper configuration (more on zipper later). The pole and tent set-up is very well thought out and is easy to set-up with one person. Thank-you Eureka for including a ground cloth! I don't know why more makers don't follow your lead there. After my limited use, it appears to be very durable and has kept me dry in moderate rainfall. Pitched once at 10K feet in moderate wind and performed great even without adding guy lines. 
There are a couple of things I have found that were less than perfect for me and both are definitely livable issues. The first one is the color coding in combination with the rain-fly. If one follows the color coding as directed then you might end up with the bigger vestibule on the side you did not plan for. After taking everything up and rotating 180 degrees, I realized I could have ignored the color coding and just set the fly how I wanted. I've done this a few times since and I have not noticed any issues. Second, in order to accommodate more headroom the zipper is quite difficult to get used to. Most of my experiences have been with zippers that are in the same plane, this one requires a zig-zag motion at the apex (where Eureka has given us more headroom). At first I thought it was going to be a game changer for me, because I kept thinking the zipper was getting stuck. I allowed it multiple uses before making a final decision and have come to learn that after a few times using, the brain must get used to the different motion. Day two of a four day outing and I had forgot all about it, but the whole trip I appreciated the extra headroom. 
This tent has so many positive things about it, plenty of storage, versatility (can be set-up with just ground cloth and fly), ease of set-up, and decent weight for it's size. I would recommend this tent to anyone looking for a good 2-3 season tent.
review.name: Great little tent

review.reviewBody:
I finally had to replace my good friend Eureka 2-man Backcountry. I wanted more room and updated features and looked at the Summer Pass 3. Great choice. With two doors and vestibules it offers plenty of room but at a good weight. The full dome coverage provides great poor weather protection. 
Set up is easy, but set it up in the backyard before hitting the trail and not being rained on.  The main tent is a conventional symmetrical hexagon while the fly sets up to a specific orientation. Once you do a full practice set up-you got it. 
For a 3-person, 2-door, 2-vestibule tent you can't do better for the price.
review.name: Great features, value!

hasVariant.name: Vert ChromaPop Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Vert ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have approximately a 24"/61cm round head and these fit comfortably and snugly for biking or other physical activities. However even though Smith offer larger XL frame sizes in many of their styles and these fit as expected, I feel these could be offered in an even bigger, wider size. These fit very similarly to the Shift XL Mag even though that model is considered an XL frame. They should show a "temple to temple" dimension as lens width doesn't give you the whole picture. I guess what I'd like to see is an XXL of the Leadout Pivlock that is wider in particular, for better coverage. Other than that, I think Smith could offer an even darker lens option to their darkest 10% VLT, like an 8% or even less - I only wear sunglasses when it's really sunny after all and 10% is sometimes not enough.
review.name: Good comfortable fit, but could be even larger and lenses darker

review.reviewBody:
These are oversized sunglasses with lots of protection although when used with a helmet they do not appear oversized anymore - even if you have small head/face. 
I've tried a half dozen Smith glasses and on a personal level, the section that sits on the bridge of my nose makes these glasses the most comfortable for me.
review.name: Over Sized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: These are the best sunglasses I've ever owned. They are the first pair of sunglasses that don't slip slowly down my face. I bought them for inline skating and they never moved. I've been a big fan of Smiths fishing sunglasses for years and have owned many over the years, but the Verts blow any of my Smith fishing sunglasses out of the water.
review.name: Forgot I was wearing sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I’m generally a huge fan of Smith eyewear. However, the frameless lens concept is a complete fail. I have owned three separate pairs of the Smith frameless sunglasses. All have broken at the connection between the lenses and the arm.
review.name: Frameless Glasses

review.reviewBody: I love how lightweight these glasses feel - I can wear them all day and barely notice. I've used them for trail running, mountain biking, and road biking, and they perform amazing in all conditions. Easy to swap to clear lenses on the move if you need to.
review.name: super light and great lenses

review.reviewBody: I tried the VERT glasses for the first time at L’Etape du Tour and I was instantly blown away, I didn’t think it was possible to have a new favourite pair of glasses (my go to being the bobcats) but these tick all the boxes for me, good looks, lightweight and great quality. You almost forget they’re there because they’re so light and you can just focus on doing your thing 😊 I’m looking forward to trying them out running too!
review.name: My New Favourites

name: Vert ChromaPop Sunglasses

hasVariant.name: Obex Spin Helmet

hasVariant.name: Obex Spin Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Obex Spin Helmet online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Obex Spin Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Obex Spin Helmet online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the POC impact technology, but the overall sizing features are lacking in my opinion compared to other helmets I've had; the ear pieces constantly come unhooked, though they are replaceable with the audio speaker inserts, so I understand why, but still feels pretty cheap and insecure. Also the chin strap and internal sizing ring is not that comfortable. It is workable, but not great.
review.name: Excited for POC Technology

review.reviewBody:
Woman with a fairly large head here. I had a terrible time finding a helmet that fits. I measure pretty much medium (57 mm) in most brands/styles, BUT my head is too oval shaped -- the back of my head and forehead would get crushed. I tried larges with BOAs and they would come down so low, my goggles would get pushed below my nose and the BOA dial would jab into the back of my neck. I ordered this helmet (POC Obex Spin) in the M/L and it was PERFECT. I mean, as though it were made for me. It must be my Swedish ancestry.

*Edit to add: It does fit nicely with my goggles (Oakley & Giro) -- no gap, nice air flow.
review.name: It fits!

review.reviewBody: This helmet is very well constructed and looks pretty good. As I understand it from talking to the Gearheads, the SPIN technology is also top of the line when it comes to concussion protection, perhaps even superior to MIPS. The helmet is very comfortable around the head, though the ear pieces are pretty tight - I think they do this in part to ensure that your ears stay warm. The odd part about this helmet is the audio compatibility: it's only compatible with POC brand audio, not 3rd party, such as Smith or Sweet Protection,, and the POC audio is difficult to find aftermarket. Not many places sell it (Backcountry does not, at least currently), it's expensive, and there's very little information about how it works on the POC website (for example, are there any controls for volume or power on the outside, like for other brands? Who knows?). I also can't find an aftermarket bluetooth audio. I'm not a fan of the proprietary audio, and I appreciate how most of the other helmet brands out there let you add your own audio. That said, if you are going to require proprietary audio, it should be easier to purchase. Were it not for this issue, I'd likely keep this helmet, but as is it's a no go for me. I don't ride with audio often, but the flexibility to have music on the lift is something I've become accustomed to.
review.name: High quality, poor audio choice

name: Obex Spin Helmet

review.reviewBody: I struggle when buying sports bras but have finally found a bra that is soft supportive and comfortable
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Crazily small must be for a child, really narrow normally would fit 8-10 but this must be for a 12 year old
review.name: Sports bra

review.reviewBody: Tiny! Couldn’t even get it on! All other SB size small fit me
review.name: Too tight

review.reviewBody: I have plenty of stamina bras in the old design which fit true to size. The new design isn't true to size !! So small fitting, too tight cuts into my ribs ,just so uncomfortable! Please change the fitting rating to reflect how small fitting the new design of stamina bra is!
review.name: Please change the fit rating to small fitting!

review.reviewBody: I don’t know how this sports bra went into production. It’s far too low at the sides, and a medium looked like it was made for a child. Very disappointing from sweaty betty and will stop me trusting them for sports bras.
review.name: Far too small and cut too low at the sides

review.reviewBody: I have to agree with other reviews, the sizing is all over the place with these. I ordered the white one in a medium (size 10/12 for reference) and I love it! Super comfy. Loved it so much I ordered the black in the same size and it’s literally TINY. Such a shame as it’s now sold out in the larger sizes
review.name: Inconsistent sizing

review.reviewBody: The medium top does not fit a medium body! As a size 10-12 (UK) this was stupidly small for me. I’m not sure a large would have fitted either. The cut is a bit strange too.
review.name: Very small

review.reviewBody: Really nice, slightly tight on the neck. Fine for a workout but I wore it all day and it rubbed either side of my neck. Size up.
review.name: Comfy

name: Stamina Workout Bra - Women's

hasVariant.name: Mondo Evo Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Mondo Evo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mondo Evo Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Mondo Evo Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have two pairs of Garneau bibs and really like them,  I got these in an xl-  I'm 5'9" and 185 lbs (think more athletic/thick) than standard skinny cyclist.  XL has been correct across Garneau previously and Castelli.  The quality is good, but they are too short-   I am not tall, and the bib straps are too tight length wise and they are short on the leg. That is not a function of being bigger in thighs or buttocks, but length is weird.
review.name: good quality- sizing is weird

review.reviewBody: Excelente product love it
review.name: Excelente

review.reviewBody: Sadly these shorts are, well, short. The inseam is maybe 9 inches. Not only that, the grippers don't grip. These shorts ride up to the point that they might be mistaken for a Speedo.
review.name: Hmmm, not great.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these in 2021. That pair was comfortable and fit well.  The new pair, same size, is tight and uncomfortable.  It's as if a large pair was mislabeled XL or Louis Garneau downsized the design. Very disappointed.
review.name: Not what  I bought two years ago

review.reviewBody: If you prefer a short without strong leg grippers, this is your short.  I have used this short for years until it eventually tore and fell apart between the panels.  Like most bike shorts they get baggier over time. The pad is pretty comfortable, even for hours in the saddle on the trainer on a TT bike. I recently repurchased them (they were on sale) in a medium (I’m 6’0 168lb) Shoulder straps are way too tight, and the lack of decent leg adhesion makes for a short which rides up in a most irritating way. On the trainer or out in the real world, i was constantly hiking them down.  There are better options at a similar price point.
review.name: Ok, not great.

review.reviewBody: I've purchased 3 pairs of these bibs over the past couple of years. Comfortable and durable; these things really hold up. They are worth the money, particularly if you buy them on sale. I ride my road bike 200+ days a year (4-5000 miles/year), and alternate between pairs. Ride, machine wash on gentle, & hang dry. I estimate that each pair lasts in excess of 5000 miles before they start to break down primarily from sun exposure and washing. About once a year I retire my oldest pair and purchase a new pair when they go on sale.
review.name: Excellent bibs

review.reviewBody: I love the shoulder straps on these bibs and also the overall look. But man, it is very uncomfortable in the crotch! I thought for a minute I had purchased women's bibs they were that uncomfortable.
review.name: Uncomfortable in the frontal region

review.reviewBody:
These shorts are *almost* great, but one design choice ruined them for me. The material used in the leg grippers - and also, inexplicably, a diagonal pattern across the front of each thigh - is terrible. Thin as a sheet of plastic wrap, almost totally transparent, and doesn't stretch as readily as the rest of the material in the shorts. Sent them back after a test fit - didn't even bother trying to ride in them. The fit is far too weird. 

It's a bummer, because the main material of the shorts, the overall fit (sizing, bib strap length, etc) and the chamois all seemed top-notch. I wish kit makers would stop putting different materials in their shorts just for the sake of marketing. Went with the more basic "Fit Sensor 3" shorts, and while the chamois on those isn't as impressive, the shorts material is at least consistently comfortable throughout the entire leg.
review.name: So close, but no

review.reviewBody:
I really like the overall feel of these.  The fabric is nice, the fit is great and they look good.  They don?t ride up or climb up you log like others.  Plenty of fabric while also being compressive.   Nice height up the torso as well.   I?d give these a 5 if they had a better chamois. The bibs are endurance but the chamois is not.  I have another pair of LG?s with the same chamois that I generally only wear on the indoor trainer.  These are better than that.  A sturdier chamois would make these perfect.  I?d say these are great for 20/25 mile rides when you really want to give it some gas.   I did a 50 in these today and my butt hurts. 

I picked up a second pair of these but in grey.   For whatever reason the chamois feels a little bit nicer.  The colored bands I could take or leave, but I would say I'm more pleased overall.  I've been riding The Black Bibs Plus before I got these.   I have a ton of chaffing from them and had to stop using them.   These have a much better fabric that interacts with my skin.  I wouldn't call it as high end as some other bibs, but this is a nice pair of bibs.   Both of them I bought on sale...if these were say $130...I'd give them 5 starts.

I picked up my 3rd pair of these on sale again.   The 3rd pair has the upgraded chamois as well.   My first pair did not last long.   They got a hole in them in the first year that I had to patch.   They have been relegated to "indoor trainer bibs".   The 2nd pair are still great.  They are super comfortable but I don't love the grey bands.   Hopefully the latest pair, in black with the new chamois, is the best of both worlds.

Longer term review here.   All 3 pairs have holes in them on the inner thigh.   Some on the right side some on the left.   I ride 3 different bikes, so I doubt there is something rubbing against on just one of the bikes.    Could have been the wash, could have been something else...but all three now have patches on them covering the holes.
review.name: Nice bibs, fit great...comfy.   Fragile.

review.reviewBody: Went on my first ride today in these. The material is top notch. Soft, flexible and breathable.  After 15 miles on a rough mountain bike trail I give them 5 stars.
review.name: So comfortable

name: Mondo Evo Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch District 4 Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Never an issue with quality or service from Mystery Ranch
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: I got the district about a month ago and love the pockets and different areas of the bag.  I’m a volunteer firefighter in a rural community and with a very active schedule, when I’m on the run it’s perfect to respond to calls with just the bare minimum I need with me.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: I brought this, because I was always leaving my phone, gps, etc, in my truck, tractor. Now I keep this and more, it is always with me, in my District 4.
review.name: this District 4, Outstanding little bag.

review.reviewBody:
Things I like:
1) it's tall enough to hold my prescription sunglasses in their case in a vertical position which makes it easy to grab
2) the opening across the top allows easy access to main compartment
3) the strap works well slung over the shoulder, across the body or around the waist
front stash pocket and rear slash pocket work well for quick access items (keys, phone, etc)
4) the square shape fits easily into a larger day pack
5) competitively priced
6) the Tiger Orange color
7) well made with quality material 

Things I don't like:
1) needs a grab/carry handle
2) the 3/16” webbing near the bottom looks good but I find it isn't very functional.  I would like an additional strap near the top of the bag with which to attach a carabiner. (I don't like things dangling below the main body of the pack).
3) I am right handed but I found the strap buckle to be located on the 'wrong' side.  When wearing across my body I prefer the strap to go over my right shoulder and the bag to be on my left side.

I added a paracord handle to the strap attachment points.

I swapped the strap around to suit the way I carry the bag.  In other words, the release buckle is now on the opposite side from it's original position.
review.name: Happy with purchase

review.reviewBody: It seems finding the perfect "all the time" bag has been more difficult than it should, until now.  I love this bag. The size is perfect. Large enough for me, without being too big or bulky.  The front outside pocket holds keys and chapstick.  Inside, various sized sleeves hold all the things.  I can even fit a kindle in a case easily.  I'm sure I could fit more if I needed to, but if I don't need it why make it heavier.  Skinny straps usually start to irritate my shoulder and neck if there is a little weight to the bag I'm carrying.  This one has yet to do that, and somehow it just stays in place.  The padded pocket in the back is perfect for my phone.  Tucks in perfectly and I can feel it vibrate if there is a call.  I love the fact that when wearing it, I can unzip it fully and nothing falls out.  (I haven't worn it as a hip bag/fanny pack....but I totally could.) Adjusting the shoulder strap is a snap. I got the gray, which the zipper pulls and branding have a slight blue/green tint to them.  I think this bag would work out for either gender just fine.  I haven't had it for very long, but I don't have any worries about durability.  I think I finally found a bag I will carry for a really long time. I think it's fantastic.
review.name: Small but mighty

review.reviewBody:
This is a deceptive bag - it is a perfect size for urban essentials while looking smaller than it is.  The expandable pockets make finding things from the top very easy, snd the pocket in back is perfect for a phone. I was sporting an Osprey Daylite (6L) before, but this sits better on my hip and Carrie’s the same amount (in a 4L package).  All in all pretty happy.

Is it perfect for longer journies like flights and hikes - maybe not.  But, for around town, it’s fantastic.
review.name: Great build for urban adventures

review.reviewBody: Bought for my wife,  loves it for sight seeing trips, Zoo walks and daily use
review.name: perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Does the trick. I was looking for a low key camera bag to use for quick shoots and hide my gear when needed. I wish they made a District 6, just to add a few more things in there as the District 8 is too much visually to keep a low visual key in cities. My 5th Mystery Ranch bag, hard to imagine buying bags from anywhere else. Quality is solid, price is you get what you pay for, buy once cry once…
review.name: Less is More

review.reviewBody: I bought this for everyday use and it is great. Fits exactly what you need: keys, headphones, wallet, even Red Bull. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag and regret spending my hard earned money on it !!
review.name: over priced

name: District 4 Bag
