hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Cirque III Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to use as a double weave softshell for alpine mountaineering and it's been perfect. It works as advertised and it's hard to find any fault with it.

It's flexible and breathes well so you don't get sweaty with it on. It's sufficiently and modestly wind resistant and water resistant. Light snowfall and sitting on snow didn't soak through and it held up fine against heavy winds (enough so that I didn't feel a need for a hardshell on top)

It's pretty durable and has taken accidental impalements with a crampon without falling apart,  likewise for catching it with an ice axe.

It's marketed as 3-season pants but I took it up Mt Fuji for a winter summit and it performed great. Great all around.
review.name: Amazing mountaineering softshell pants

review.reviewBody:
The design is odd with a net pocket within the front right (zipper) pocket, no rear left pocket, a flimsy buckle that will probably not last sub zero temps.
Material seems durable and I do like the gusseted ankle zipper pant legs and reinforced scuff guards.
review.name: Odd Design / Could have been much better pants

review.reviewBody: I am a big and tall guy. 6’ 3” 300+. But I still absolutely love being outdoors and going on adventures, I have never been able to find a pair of outdoor pants that would ever fit right. Let’s be honest, there are some really cool companies that only make sizes that stop at the XL size. Not OR, I wear a 48” waist and 34 length. And these pants fit so unbelievably well. I got them for a three week trip across Europe. We started in the rain in Amsterdam and finished in the snow in Zermatt. These pants fit every single occasion I threw at them. Warm when they needed to be, cool enough not to overheat, dry in the rain, and stretched perfectly on the slopes. Basically, they just fit right.
review.name: Big guy needed big Pants

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using these pants for backcountry skiing and have been extremely satisfied with them. Despite being a soft shell, I have not issues with water or windproofness. The expandable cuff is fantastic for fitting over ski boots without being excessively large when wearing other footwear. All in all fantastic gear!
review.name: Great pants for backcountry skiing!

review.reviewBody: Cirque III alpine pants are very well made, reasonably priced,  and will be a good addition to my backcountry gear. They also have shorter inseam lengths which is appreciated. One item that is lacking is an inside powder cuff on the pant legs. I'm an avid alpine and backcountry skier averaging 50+ days/year so they will get used often.

I have had two pairs of the cirque one pant prior to this one.  Sadly I had to warranty both of them on account of the little zippers failing on the pockets leading me to sew them shut to keep from getting pocket fulls of snow.  Thankfully OR has a fantastic warranty and warranty service!!! Disappointingly they are still using the same zippers on these pants.

I live and ski in Utah.  I wear these pants both the resort and in the backcountry and find the stretch and breathability of the pants to be just what I want while still keeping out the cold and wet.  I have ice climbed in them, and done mountaineering adventures in them.  While they can be too warm for summer missions and not water proof enough for winter attempts in the cascades they cover are just right the majority of the time and paired with a hard shell for full on blizzards are still my go to pants for snowy adventures in the mountains!
review.name: Great, but please bulk up the pocket zippers!

review.reviewBody: Having never had true mountaineering pants before, I did some research, and decided on these. I don’t regret it. They’re quality made, tough, and thoughtfully built. I’m 5’8 and got the small and short size, as I have shorter legs, and the fit is good. I will update this review if anything changes with the pants.
review.name: Great pants for outdoor adventures.

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants after the reviews here and getting a review from some friends on the company overall. I have been hiking the past couple days out in Utah and these pants have been amazing. They have been able to withstand the snow, wind, and mud. The pockets allow for venting which is nice because the temps have been changing quite a bit. Sizing runs true to fit so be prepared for that. Would highly recommend these if your looking for something for winter activities that require you to be active in.
review.name: Great active pant

review.reviewBody: Best softshell I've ever worn! Warm a durable with no loss of movement. Have been perfect for ice climbing and winter biking.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
Just received these pants 2 weeks ago. As soon I tried them on I knew they were special. I own the Cirque I pant in small, which are a bit short and tight @ the waist. These new model I bought in medium, and they seem just right. The pockets have changed, however, and for the better.
All are larger, and quite capacious.
review.name: Great pant for rough conditions

name: Cirque III Pant - Men's

Can't justify the cost of a new one if it keeps letting me down. Will be buying a Force 22 at more than half the price.
review.name: Love my lightweight components, but.....

review.reviewBody: I love those bag it's sp versatile i use ot everyday

review.reviewBody: I use this bag all the time. Yes, the strap that causes the bag to collapse is annoying (as mentioned in other reviews) but this is a wonderful bag that is versatile and attractive. It was exactly what I was looking for and has been a great addition to my wardrobe.

review.reviewBody:
I love that these feel like sneakers on my feet but wear like a hiking shoe.
I'm a teacher I buy them to wear through the winter months in the snow and ice. . . . they are fashionable enough and perfection function for this time of year.
Then in the spring I wear them for the small lawn care business I have.
They are perfect to keep my feet dry in wet grass and great durability through the season")
Not sure how you would fix this . . . . . but they seem slippery when wet on tile or very hard flat surfaces.
review.name: Amazing footwear")!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these "boots". I use quotation marks because they wear more like an aggressive shoe. I work in a garden center and need a lighter weight boot, waterproof and able to move and flex with the different work I do. I am a woman, and bought the darker color because I need one that will hide the dirt and evidence of where I work ((those light colors just don't work for me). I wear a 9. 5 in women's and bought an 8 in mens. . . perfect!
review.name: I am thrilled!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of zionics, and not because they wore out. The new ones were broke in by the third day of use. They are comfortable and supportive in the ankles, heals and arches. Push off is fantastic when hiking due to the aggressive sole. They are a little spendy but I think worth the investment in my feet.
review.name: They are great!

review.reviewBody: These hiking boots are incredibly comfortable and meet the high-quality standards I’ve come to expect from Keen. The waterproofing performs flawlessly, as always, and the boots are both lightweight and sturdy. The lug pattern on the tread provides excellent traction, just as advertised. I’ll definitely be purchasing another pair. Great job, Keen!
review.name: Classic Keen comfort & durability!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and good traction, but the lugs on the sole started falling off within 5 months (<160 miles). I've always loved Keen's durability and longevity, but these soles do not live up to Keen's standards. I returned them to the retailer.
review.name: Great fit but soles fall apart

review.reviewBody:
Was very excited to try these boots, but that excitement quickly left when I went to Silver Falls State Park. I was with 2 other people, one had on a running sneaker & the other another local PNW brand trail shoe… they had little to know issues. Me however with these. Nothing but constant slipping & sliding. 

This is unfortunate because they are comfy! :(
review.name: Silver Falls State Park - Slip & Slide Review

review.reviewBody: Stable with excellent ankle support. Very handsome shoes!
review.name: Very stable hikers

review.reviewBody: Nothing but 100% quality, but I should have gone with the next half size up.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Fitz well looks great comfortable Shoe great hiking boot mid boot
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Versus the nxis I've worn, I found these to be narrow. Without a wide option, i had to return for a refund.
review.name: Small to size

name: Zionic Mid WP Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: My older Cyclops trainer was designed for quick release 135mm hubs. That’s one of the old standards, Kids! New fangled thru-axle designs don’t fit without this adapter kit. It’s an easy swap and works perfectly.
review.name: Makes an old trainer new again!

review.reviewBody: I needed to add a couple washers since the thru axle is for a 148 but it worked great.
review.name: Works with my posiden redwood 142

review.reviewBody: It took some extra time and expertise from bike shop crews to figure out exactly which kit I needed (determined it was based on thread pitch which I couldn’t do on my own). Once I ordered it, it was a dream! Easy to install and feels very solid. I’m very happy.it works fine with my Cyclops trainer.
review.name: Mountain bike used on the Cyclops trainer

review.reviewBody: Great thru axle to use my gravel vike on the trainer during the cold weather!
review.name: Great thru axle!

review.reviewBody: Product fits perfectly on my bike and I had no trouble installing it
review.name: Bike trainer thru axle adapter

review.reviewBody: I needed an axle adapter to get my Saris trainer to work with my Trek bike. To make sure I got the right one for my make and model, I sent a note to Saris report and got an answer the next morning. Ordered the part, it arrived pronto, and now I'm pedaling indoors through the cold wintry weather.
review.name: Fast service

review.reviewBody: Excellent product. I want to give 4/5 because I really wish a few more spacers were included, but that's not technically a flaw, but a preference. I used all spacers to make one side even with the other as for as protrusion, but had to leave the opposite devoid of spacers.
review.name: Great adapter, works well, want more spacers

review.reviewBody: Good product, easy to use. Exactly what was needed for my wife’s bike that had different sized threads on the thruaxle than mine.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: It does what it promises to do. No hassle delivery
review.name: Works as promised!

review.reviewBody: I needed this to adapt my through axle MTB on my Saris M2 trainer. It fits perfectly and does what is advertised. I just think it is too expensive for a big bolt.
review.name: Works as advertised but expensive

name: Thru Axle Adapter

review.reviewBody: Hurt my feet and knees and caused aching in my lower legs. Returned both pairs.

I’m not a dedicated runner but I made it my goal to walk more this summer. And you still need a good shoe for walking and I found the Glycerin 21 to be the perfect shoe for me. It feels like you’re walking on pillows. My feet are truly happy now especially if you’re dealing with plantar fasciitis and a high arch like myself.
review.name: BLH

review.reviewBody: Great shoe, I’m not a runner but I am on my feet all day and the cushioning is awesome. I have a couple of pairs.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: Super tight on the sides/narrow, created friction spots on foot. Lots of cushion. Might be a good fit for some just didn’t work out for me and will have to return.
Having a narrow foot, I’ve had trouble finding any shoes that fit my feet. These shoes surprisingly fit well, they’re now my go to shoe
review.name: Pure Comfort

review.reviewBody: I was initially going to return these shoes as they were not very cushioned as described after about 5-10 miles in them they softened up quite a bit and are now pretty comfy to wear.  In this day and age I was expecting cloud like comfort out of the box which these do not provide but do soften up quite a bit after "break in".  My wife and I go on daily 3+ mile walks so comfort is very important.  I do think these will wear a lot better than some other brands I have been using.
review.name: Needs a short break in period to enjoy the comfort.

review.reviewBody: Bought two sets of this model. The first a regular width and they killed my feet. Intense pain on exterior parts of my feet and little toes. Opted to buy another in a wide version and experienced the same effect. The toe cup on both sets also creased nearly immediately, and caused further toe pain.
review.name: Painful shoe

review.reviewBody: These are the lightest walking/running  shoes my size 14 feet have ever been in! It has a soft top. The inside is firm yet soft (Firft? Sirm?). It’s not mushy. I got the all black version. They don’t scream “Oh! Look at me, I run!” These were recommended to me by my podiatrist because of some problems I am having with a callus on my foot. I’m using these for treadmill walking ATM but will be using them for outdoor exercise in the warmer months and when we travel.
review.name: Doctor recommended

review.reviewBody: I'm a dog walker, who puts in in excess of  5 miles a day, every day. Brooks Glycerins keep my feet comfortable all day. The Glycerin 20 was a wonderful shoe for fit and comfort for me. The Glycerin 21 has a redesigned toe box that so far (after 2 weeks) is less comfortable for my feet. The extra padding in the sole is helpful, but I hope they go back to the old toe box shape. These are a little shorter in the same size designation. On an aesthetic note, the color selection is rather odd for the 21's.
review.name: Not as good as the Glycerin 20

review.reviewBody:
I would give zero stars if possible.  I’ve been wearing Brooks for years and the recent changes have ruined the shoe.  The nitro infused sole (glycerin 20 & 21) has ruined the shoe.  It causes severe pain in the ball of foot. I’ve purchased several pairs thinking it was just an “off” pair but they all cause the pain.   
The shoe also feels more narrow than previous shoes.  Time for a new brand.

name: Glycerin 21 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very light yet warm and durable
review.name: I would buy every color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pant for all conditions
review.name: Great pair of ski pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wanted something light for spring skiing days and also water proof and these pants did not disappoint. Columbia makes a great and affordable product.
review.name: Great pair of pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Snowboarding pants are so comfortable as well as durible.
review.name: More fun on the Slopes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pants worked well for skiing, but the Velcro shredded my shirt unfortunately.
review.name: Velcro shredded my shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing piece of equipment. Runs very slightly small. Keep that in mind. Again slightly.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a ski instructor at a small resort in Ohio. Lots of lift rides which results in a lot of wear and tear on snow pants. The Seymore Pant is the best snow pants I've ever owned. In several seasons these pants haven't shown wear and haven't lost any waterproofing. This is a second seymore pant (have black, wanted tan) and they fit perfect and are warm on cold days and stay cool on 40 degree days.. Love these things!
review.name: Best NF Snow Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice quality pants

review.reviewBody: The material was so rough and the back of your jacket is so big that look very weird also the arm is so short.
review.name: Not impressed

review.reviewBody: Saw this jacket on the Patagonia website and NEEDED it. I don?t usually feel this way but when I do I can be obsessive. I then realized it was kid sizing...and the tuber tan didn?t come in XL or XXL. I thought about risking a L but decided against it and so glad I did. I was so excited to see Backcountry stocked size XL and didn?t hesitate. The XL fits just a hair smaller than I?d like but I?m keeping it. I can wear it open or closed but I imagined an oversized fit. I can wear a sweatshirt under it comfortably but it looks a bit stuffed. The jacket is very lightweight but still warm. It feels like polyester the inside, but that will likely block the wind. The outside is not overly soft (which I am happy about). The snaps are plastic so even though it looks vintage it has a very light and modern feel.
review.name: Purchased for adult
comment: Wow didn't realize this was child size until I read your review - Patagonia should make it for adults!

name: Retro-X Bomber Jacket - Girls'

description: Buy the Saris Bones 3-Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bones 3-Bike Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris Bones 3-Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works great and easy to use! Looking forward to many trips
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody:
Perfect choice for convertible cars, that can't have bike rack on the top.
Didn't tried 3 fully mtbs, but strong enough to carry 2 of them.
Relatively easy installation.
Very high quality, lightweight.
Minus 1 star for necessity to install and removal every time, and for straps, that can scratch your trunk on high speed (because of wind), and for price, too much for plastic rack.
Overall very a good device!
review.name: Fits nice to my convertible! Strong to hold 2 mtb!

review.reviewBody: I have had this bike carrier for 8 years. Used it on my mini. Now trying to fit to my fiat 500e. Are the feet on this carrier the same as the bones ex3? Just noticed in the pictures here they rest on the bumper. (Fiat 500e not big enough - the feet are not fully supported by the bumper). However in the Bones Ex3 they rest against the side of the car. Can I rest them against the side of the car with this model?
review.name: Fitting to Fiat 500

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Bones 3-Bike Carrier and could NOT be happier.  This Carrier is genius designed product.  Thank you for designing a carrier that makes sense and is of top quality.
review.name: Genius Design

review.reviewBody: My son got one and when I saw it I was so impressed that I had to get one for myself. Very versatile and easy to use.
review.name: Bought Two

review.reviewBody: I have owned a Saris 2-bone trunk mounted bike rack for a number of years. It has given me excellent service and I have always had confidence in the rack to travel where ever I wished to go for my next ride. Now that my two grandsons have expressed an interest in riding bikes with Grandpa, the 3-bone version became a necessity. I fine that I can carry their bikes easily with my road bike or my FX2 Hybrid. Further, this version seems to allow for easier stowage for those times I am not hauling a bike(s) along. This is an addition I wish I had made a couple of years ago. Very pleased with the results.
review.name: Improved Capabilities

review.reviewBody: The whole structure is great and I can see why this is so firm and stable, however, if only the arms can be maneuver with better ideas would be great. Maybe a quick release or something. Overall I'm happy as long as I can ferry my bikes and safely which is my main priority. Lastly, I think the price can be lowered slightly, I don't find the price justified to the product because of what I suggested with the arms. Implement with a quick-release would be great!
review.name: Too good to be true

review.reviewBody:
This rack is easy to use, fits my car and sort of fits multiple bikes. I've had the team for 5 years now and it's been very solid. With modern mt bikes being the size and geometry they are they take up a lot of space. That being said, it's very difficult, if not impossible, to fit the bikes on the three bike rack. On top of that, the grey "padding", out whatever it is, rubs off and gets all over my bike frame. While this doesn't damage the frame, as far as I can tell, it's ugly and kind of disconcerting that it's coming off at all and makes me wonder when it will start damaging the paint on my frame. 
I recently replace both the arms (within six months) and the grey stuff started rubbing off almost immediately. I've had to start wrapping some spare cloth around my frame to protect it.
review.name: Nice rack but..

review.reviewBody: I have had experiences with two other leading brands of bike racks and now happy to have found Saris. This rack fits my Honda Fit superbly and set-up was lightning fast and intuitive to use. The rack is very lightweight and seems very durable. The bike fits very well.
review.name: SO easy to set up, lightweight and very durable

review.reviewBody: So far the time I have used it the results have been great
review.name: Easy  to use

name: Bones 3-Bike Rack

review.reviewBody: Favorite winter gear for my son, second winter I have purchased. Durable and warm!
review.name: I buy this every year!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this snowsuit, second winter in a row I have purchased for my son. Very warm and easy for him to put on and off.
review.name: Favorite winter gear for my son!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my great grandson for the winter. I put on a wolf skin ruff as an added wind breaker as we can get violent harsh winters here at Gambell, Alaska.
review.name: I would most diffently buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: I put on a wolf ruff to this so my grandchild is VERY well prepared for the harsh St. Lawrence Island, Alaska weather at any time.
review.name: I would most definitely buy it.

review.reviewBody: It is a perfect fit for my 4yr old son. He can easily move around and lift objects with ease with the snow suit on. Quality of the product is excellent. Will purchase it again!
review.name: The best snow suit for kids.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit for kids wanting to play in the snow. Used for my daughter who is first time skier and kept her warm and dry. Only thermals down under. Put a north face jacket on top of this and she was good to go.
review.name: Wish they made these for adults.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and comfortable. My baby did not complain
review.name: Nice warm snow suit

name: Freedom Snow Suit - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: These shoes have good stability to negotiate uneven sidewalk panes upended by tree roots in our neighborhood. Comfortable for all-day wear and looks great with outfits!
review.name: Good walking shoe

review.reviewBody: Great quality and so comfortable. I love wearing them with everything.
review.name: Love to wear with everything!

review.reviewBody: My 15 year old daughter loves them! They fit great.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing New Balance for about 40 years! Love the comfort, support and looks.
review.name: Love New Balance

review.reviewBody: The shoes were full of rice and mouse droppings. We do not have rice in our home, so know it happened prior to us receiving them.
review.name: Mouse nest

review.reviewBody: I've always loved New Balance shoes because of the style, quality and the comfort. It's been years since I've purchased New Balance shows and I'm glad I did. New Balance seems to stay true to their brand and the customer by providing nice shoes that are comfortable to wear.
review.name: I went back to my first love

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable and stylish. Big bonus got them on sale. Will definitely repurchase from this site good experience all round
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: My daughter wears them everyday during gym and other activities. Highly recommend.
review.name: Present for daughter

review.reviewBody: The sole started peeling away from the shoe before my son finished his first semester of college.  These weren't even his everyday shoes.
review.name: Didn't last a semester of college

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, the wide is very wide, more a boxy wide, but so comfortable. Recently wore them on a trip and got lots of compliments.
review.name: Great shoe!!!

review.reviewBody: Used this on the high camps for Iztacchuatl and Orizaba in Mexico and it was fantastic. Easily the best sleeping mat I’ve ever used.
review.name: Used this on the high

review.reviewBody: I used this mat for the first time out in Snowdonia in temps around 0 to -4 and the mat ensured I had a warm nights sleep. Easy to inflate, relatively small pack size and a cute elephant stash sack. Could be lighter compared to some other brands but we are taking grams.
review.name: I used this mat for

review.reviewBody: good for sun protection, not too warm for being wool, looks good.
review.name: it's a nice hat

review.reviewBody: I have ordered three Moab hats from Backcountry,  count em, three. Each one shows up,  good looking,  functional and the crown and brim are not aligned with the chasis. I.E. the sweatband and vents don't align with the crown or curve of the brim on all three hats.  No clue what to do to get a straight hat.  Shame on Stetson and shame on Backcountry. What a bummer
review.name: Great looking,  poorly made.

review.reviewBody: Cool western style hat that's great for those drizzly PNW mornings or long days on the river when a ball cap isn't enough. Water repellent, however since it's wool felt rather than fur felt I used some silicone weather guard to reinforce it.
review.name: Love This Hat

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago and happy about the purchase. Silent shifting great price does what it says it's supposed to do.
review.name: Silent shifting

review.reviewBody: My chain and cassette needed replacement on my Cervelo R3SL with Shimano 105 rear derailleur and I considered more expensive options before choosing this SRAM PG-1050. It works beautifully and shifts precisely and silently. We'll see about how well it lasts but so far I'm very satisfied.
review.name: Great cassette at great price

hasVariant.name: MegNeg Upgrade Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the RockShox MegNeg Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Upgraded my Rockshox Superdeluxe Select with the Megneg can.  Immediately noticeable  when riding over chatter like  roots, rocks and such at speed.  I?m 185 lbs.  The Megneg can requires more PSI so I?m running it at about 215psi to achieve 30% sag.  I then added 1 (supplied) volume spacer to the negative air chamber and performance improved even more.  Very planted, controlled feel yet still plush over rough sections AND sits much higher in its travel.  Super impressed and Well worth the price !!!!
review.name: Huge difference in Superdeluxe Select

name: MegNeg Upgrade Kit

review.reviewBody:
Finding that I'm really liking this sleeveless jersey. As with most of the other Castelli kit I have, this jersey is snug and form-fitting, without being compressive and "tight". I'm slim and slender, and most other Castelli jerseys I have are size M, but needed a size L for this one. Another similar Castelli jersey is only a half-zip, so this full-zip helps with cooling on really super-hot rides. Also planning on wearing in upcoming cooler weather as a next-to-skin layer; it's snug enough that it shouldn't interfere with outer garments.
Another winner from Castelli!
review.name: The Usual Castelli Wonderfulness :)

review.reviewBody: The material feels good on your skin and the fit was great!  I now need some warm weather so I can wear it on a ride.
review.name: Great fit!

name: Entrata VI Sleeveless Jersey - Men's
